translation.ig: Usoro omume ihe Komen ekwenyeghị n'ịbụ nne na nna ezubere ezube n'ihi nyocha na-abịa abịa nke gbasara otu ịbụ nne na nna ezubere ezube si emefu ma na enye mkpesa ka osiri mefu ego nke onye nnọchiteanya bụ Kliff Stens na-eme.

translation.en: Stearns is investigating whether taxes are used to fund abortions through Planned Parenthood in his role as chairman of the Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee, which is under the umbrella of the House Energy and Commerce Committee.
translation.ig: Stearns na eme nyocha ichoputa ma eji utu-isi akwu-ugwo ite-ime site na ibu nne na nna ahaziri ahzi site n’oru dika onye-isi-oche nke ngalaba na ahu maka nlaba anya nyochasi, nke no n’ukpuru otu nke ulo ikike na azum-aha.

translation.en: Former Massachusetts governor Mitt Romney won the Florida Republican Party presidential primary election on Tuesday with over 46 percent of the vote.
translation.ig: Gọvanọ steeti Masachusets gara aga, Mitt Romney, meriri ntuliaka praịmarị maka nhọrọ onye isi ala nke mpaghara otu ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị Rịpọblikan nọ na Flọrida mere n'ụbọchị Tusdee ebe o nwetara karịa pasent 46 na vootu niile.

translation.en: Former U.S. Speaker of the House Newt Gingrich came in second with 32 percent.
translation.ig: Onye bụbu Ọkaokwu Ụlọnnọchiteanya mba Amerịka bụ Newt Gingrich ji pasentị 32 gbata onye nke abụọ.

translation.en: As a winner-takes-all state, Florida awarded all fifty of its delegates to Romney, pushing him ahead as the front-runner for the Republican Party nomination.
translation.ig: Dịka steeti onye meriri-na-ewere ihe niile, Florida nyere ndị nnọchi anya iri ise ha niile nye Romney, na-akwaga ya n'ihu dị ka onye na-agba oso ihu na nhọpụta nke Otu ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị Republican.

translation.en: Organisers of the protest said about 100,000 people turned up in German cities such as Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg, and Hanover.
translation.ig: Ndị nhazi ngagharị iwe ahụ kwuru n’ihe dị ka ndị mmadụ 100,000 bịara n’ụmụ obodo nke Jamanị dị ka Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg, na Hanover.

translation.en: In Berlin, police estimated 6,500 protestors.
translation.ig: Na Berlin, ndị uwe ojii mere atụmatụ ndị ngaghari iwe 6500.

translation.en: Protests also took place in Paris, Sofia in Bulgaria, Vilnius in Lithuania, Valetta in Malta, Tallinn in Estonia, and Edinburgh and Glasgow in Scotland.
translation.ig: Ngagharị iwe mekwara na Paris, Sofia n’ime Bulgaria, Vilnius n’ime Lithuania, Valetta n’ime Malta, Tallinn n’ime Estonia, na Edinburgh ma Glasgow n’ime Scotland.

translation.en: In London, about 200 people protested outside some major copyright holders' offices.
translation.ig: Na Lọndọn ihe ruru mmadụ narị abụọ kpesara n'ihu ụfọdụ ụlọọrụ isi nwebisiinka.

translation.en: Last month, there were major protests in Poland when that country signed ACTA, which has led to the Polish government deciding not to ratify the agreement, for now.
translation.ig: N'ọnwa gara aga, enwere ọtụtụ ngagharị iwe na Poland mgbe obodo a nyere ACTA nkwenye ha, nke mere ka gọọmenti Poland kpebie na ha ka ga-echere tupu ha asị nkwekọrịta ahụ gaa n'ihu..

translation.en: Latvia and Slovakia have both delayed the process of joining ACTA.
translation.ig: Ma Latvia ma Slovakia egbuola oge nke usoro isonyere ACTA.

translation.en: Animal Liberation and the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) are again calling for the mandatory installation of CCTV cameras in all Australian abattoirs.
translation.ig: Otu Animal Liberation na elekota maka na otu n’afu na akwusiri mmegbu umuanumanu nke ana akpo Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) akpola oku maka itinye igwefoto CCTV n’ime ebe niile ana egbu anu n’Australia.

translation.en: RSPCA New South Wales chief inspector David O'Shannessy told the ABC that surveillance and inspections of abattoirs should be commonplace in Australia.
translation.ig: Onye-isi ndi uwe-oji nke South Wales Ohuu RSPCA David O'Shannessy gwara ABC na nleba-anya na nyocha nke ulo-igbu-anu kwesiri idi kwa-mgbe na Australia.

translation.en: "The CCTV would certainly send a strong signal to those people working with animals that their welfare is of the highest priority."
translation.ig: Igwefoto ahụ ga ezijeriri ozi siri ike nye ndị na azụ anụmanụ na odịmma ha bụ ihe kacha mkpa.

translation.en: The United States Geological Survey international earthquake map showed no earthquakes in Iceland in the week prior.
translation.ig: Maapụ ala ọma jijiji ụwa nke United States Geological Survey gosiri na ala ọma jijiji emeghị na Iceland n'izu gasịrị tupu nke a.

translation.en: The Icelandic Meteorological Office also reported no earthquake activity in the Hekla area in the past 48 hours.
translation.ig: Ọfis Mitiọrọlọjikal nke Aịzilandị kọkwara na o nweghi ihe omume ala ọma jijiji mere n’ebe Hekla n’oge awa iri anọ na asatọ gara aga.

translation.en: The significant earthquake activity resulting in the phase change had took place on March 10 on the northeast side of the volcano's summit caldera.
translation.ig: Ala ọma jijiji ahụ dị ịrịba ama butere mgbanwe mere n'ụbọchị nke iri n'ọnwa Maachị n'ugwu ọwụwa anyanwụ nke isi ugwu mgbawa kaldera.

translation.en: Dark clouds unrelated to any volcanic activity were reported at the base of the mountain.
translation.ig: Akọrọ akụkọ igwe ojii n'enweghị ihe gbasara ha n'ihe omume ugwu mgbawa n'ụkwụ ugwu ahụ

translation.en: The clouds presented the potential for confusion as to whether an actual eruption had taken place.
translation.ig: Urukpu igwe gosipụtara ohere nke a na-enweghị ike ịkọwa ma ntiwapụ o meela n'ezie.

translation.en: The Luno had 120–160 cubic metres of fuel aboard when it broke down and high winds and waves pushed it into the breakwater.
translation.ig: The Luno nwere kubik mita 120-160 nke mmanụ n'ime ya mgbe o mebiri ma oke ifufe na ebili mmiri dubara ya n'ime brekwọta ahụ.

translation.en: Helicopters rescued the twelve crewmembers and the only injury was a broken nose.
translation.ig: Helịkọpta napụtara ndị onya ụgbọ iri na abụọ ahụ ma sọ mmerụ ahụ enwere bụ mgbawa imi.

translation.en: The 100-metre ship was en route to pick up its usual fertiliser cargo and initially officials feared the vessel could spill a load.
translation.ig: Ụgbọ mmiri toruru mita otu narị nọ n'ụzọ ibute fatịlaịza mana na mbụ ndị ọrụ nọ n'ụjọ ya iwufu ụfọdụ ibu.

translation.en: The proposed amendment already passed both houses in 2011.
translation.ig: Ndozigharị iwu achọrọ agafeela ụlọ abụọ ahụ na 2011.

translation.en: A change was made this legislative session when the second sentence was deleted first by the House of Representatives and then was passed in a similar form by the Senate Monday.
translation.ig: E mere otu mgbanwe n’oge imeiwu a mgbe ehichapụrụ ahịrị abụọ ahụ mbụ site n’aka Ụlọ ndị Nnọchiteanya ma mgbe ahụ ekwenye na ya n’ụzọ yiri site n’aka Mọnde Ndị Omeiwu.

translation.en: The failure of the second sentence, which proposes to ban same-sex civil unions, could possibly open the door for civil unions in the future.
translation.ig: Odida ahiriokwu nke abuo, nke na-asi ka amachibido alum di nwoke na nwoke ma o bu nwanyi na nwanyi nwere ike imeghe uzo ka enwe civil union  n’ihu.

translation.en: Following the process, HJR-3 will be reviewed again by the next elected legislature in either 2015 or 2016 to remain in process.
translation.ig: Esowe usoro ahụ, ndị ome iwu na-abịa abịa ga elebara HJR-3 anya ọzọ n'afọ 2015 m'ọbụ 2016.

translation.en: Vautier's achievements outside of directing include a hunger strike in 1973 against what he viewed as political censorship.
translation.ig: Ihe mmeta nke Vautier na-anọghị na ngalaba nduzi ihe ngosi gụnyere ịkwụ agụụ na 1973 megide ihe ọ hụrụ dị ka nnyocha ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị.

translation.en: French law was changed. His activism went back to age 15 when he joined the French Resistance during World War II.
translation.ig: E degharịrị iwu Fransị. Mbido mmume mgbanwe ọchịchị ya sitere n'afọ iri na ise mgbe o sonyere Ndị Agha Nguzogide Nke Fransị n'oge Agha Ụwa nke abụọ.

translation.en: He documented himself in a 1998 book.
translation.ig: Ọ dere ihe gbasara onwe ya na akwụkwọ afọ 1998.

translation.en: In the 1960s he headed back to newly-independent Algeria to teach film directing.
translation.ig: Na oge 1960 olaghachiri azu n’obodo Algeria nwere onwe ya ohuu ikuzi maka film directing.

translation.en: Japanese judoka Hitoshi Saito, winner of two Olympic gold medals, has died at the age of 54.
translation.ig: Onye mba Japan Hitoshi Saịto bụ onye ọgụ egwuregwu judo, bụkwa onye meriri onyinye ọla edo nke Olimpik ugboro abụọ, anwụọla ka ọ dị afọ iri ise na anọ.

translation.en: The cause of death was announced as intrahepatic bile duct cancer.
translation.ig: Asiri na ihe gburu ya bu intrahepatic bile duct kansa.

translation.en: He died in Osaka on Tuesday.
translation.ig: Ọ nwụrụ n’ime Osaka na Tusdee.

translation.en: As well as a former Olympic and World champion, Saito was the All Japan Judo Federation training committee chairman at the time of his death.
translation.ig: Ọ bụbu onye egwuregwu Olympic na onye mmeri n’egwuregwu ụwa, Saito bụ onye isi oche kọmiti ozuzu egwuregwu Japan Judo Federation n’oge ọ nwụrụ.

translation.en: At least 100 people had attended the party, in order to celebrate the first anniversary of a couple whose wedding was held last year.
translation.ig: Opekata mpe ihe dịka 100 mmadụ gara nnọkọ ahụ, maka isonye na mmemme ncheta otu afọ alụmdinanwunye otu di na nwunye e mere agbamakwụkwọ ha n’afọ gara aga.

translation.en: A formal anniversary event was scheduled for a later date, officials said.
translation.ig: Ndi isi si na, ihe omume nke ncheta nke onye-obula ga ama maka ya ka aga etinye na oge na abia.

translation.en: The couple had married in Texas one year ago and came to Buffalo to celebrate with friends and relatives.
translation.ig: Ha lụrụ di na nwunye otu afọ gara aga na Tekzas were bịa Buffalo ka ha na ndị enyi makwa ezinụlọ me mmemme.

translation.en: The 30-year-old husband, who was born in Buffalo, was one of the four killed in the shooting, but his wife was not hurt.
translation.ig: Di ya dị afọ iri atọ, onye a mụrụ na Buffalo, bụ otu onye n’ime mmadụ anọ e gburu n’egbe ahụ a gbara, mana nwunye ya emerụghị ahụ.

translation.en: Karno is a well-known but controversial English tutor who taught under Modern Education and King's Glory who claimed to have 9,000 students at the peak of his career.
translation.ig: Karno bụ onye a mara nke ọma ma bụrụkwa onye nkuzi Bekee omume ya na-ebute mgbagha, ọ kuziri n’okpuru Mmụta agba ọhụrụ na Ebube Eze ọ sịrị na ụmụakwụkwọ ya ruru 9,000 oge ike ọrụ ya kacha.

translation.en: In his notes he used words which some parents considered coarse, and he reportedly used profanity in class.
translation.ig: Edemede ya nwere mkpụrụ okwu ụfọdụ nne na nna cheere na odịghị mma, ekpesakwara na ọ na-ekwu okwu rụrụ arụ n'ụlọ nkụzi

translation.en: Modern Education accused him of printing large advertisements on buses without authorisation and lying by saying that he was the chief English tutor.
translation.ig: Ọmụmụ nke Ọlọrọ ọhụrụ boro ya ebubo nke ibipụta ụmụ mgbasa ozi ahịa buru ibu n’ụmụ bọọsụ na-enweghị ikikere ma na-atụ asị n’ikwu na ọ bụ onye isi ndị nkuzi Bekee.

translation.en: He has also been accused previously of copyright infringement, but was not charged.
translation.ig: Ebobukwara ya ebubo ịda iwu nwebisiinka, mana amaghị ya ikpe.

translation.en: A former student said that he 'used slang in class, taught dating skills in notes, and was just like the students' friend.'
translation.ig: Otu nwa akwukwo ochie kwuru si na ya ‘na-asu asusu nkiti nime klassi, kuzie ukpuru iyi-oyi nime akwukwo, ma diri ka nno ka enyi umu akwukwo’.

translation.en: During the last three decades, despite officially remaining a communist state, China has developed a market economy.
translation.ig: Mgbe afọ iri atọ gara aga gachara, n’agbanyeghị na ha nọ na kọmunisti steeti, China akwalitela azụmaahia obodo ha.

translation.en: The first economic reforms were made under the leadership of Deng Xiaoping.
translation.ig: E mepụtara mmezi akụ na ụba mbụ n’okpuru ọchịchị nke Deng Xiaoping.

translation.en: Since then, China's economic size has grown by 90 times.
translation.ig: Kemgbe ahụ, akụnụba obodo Chaịna ejirila mmaji iri itolu too.

translation.en: For the first time, last year China exported more cars than Germany and surpassed the United States as the biggest market for this industry.
translation.ig: Nke a bụ mbụ ọ na-eme, n'afọ gara aga Chaịna bupuru ụgbọala karịa Jamani ma gafere Amerịka dịka ahịa kachasị ukwu maka ụlọọrụ a.

translation.en: China's GDP could be larger than the United States within two decades.
translation.ig: Aku na Uba mba China nwere ike idi ukwu karia nke mba United State na agbata ogu-afo abuo

translation.en: Tropical Storm Danielle, fourth named storm of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season, has formed in the eastern Atlantic Ocean.
translation.ig: Oké mmiri ozuzo N’ebe okpomọkụ Danielle, oké mmiri ozuzo nke anọ enyere aha nke oge ajọ ifufe Atlantik 2010 ahụ, akpụọla n’ime ebe ọwụwa anyanwụ Oke osimiri Atlantik.

translation.en: The storm, located approximately 3,000 miles from Miami, Florida, has maximum sustained winds of 40 mph (64 kph).
translation.ig: Ifufe ahu, di ebe 3,000miles na Miami, Florida, o nwere ikuku ruru 40mph(64 kph).

translation.en: Scientists at the National Hurricane Center predict that Danielle will strengthen to a hurricane by Wednesday.
translation.ig: Ndị ọka mmụta sayensị na n'ụlọ nyocha ajọ ikuku nke obodo ekwuola na oke ikuku Daniel ga aghọ ajọ ikuku na ụbọchị Wenezde.

translation.en: As the storm is far from landfall, it remains difficult to assess potential impact to the United States or Caribbean.
translation.ig: Dị ka oké mmiri ozuzo ahụ ka toro aka site n’imetụ n’ala, ọ ka na-ara ahụ inyocha etu o nwere ike isi metụta United States ma ọ bụ Caribbean.

translation.en: Born in the Croatian capital, Zagreb, Bobek gained fame while playing for Partizan Belgrade.
translation.ig: A mụrụ n’isi obodo Kroeshịa, Zagreb, Bobek nwetara ọmụma mgbe ọ na-agbara Partizan Belgradi.

translation.en: He joined them in 1945 and stayed until 1958.
translation.ig: O sonyere ha na 1945 ma nọrọ ruo 1958.

translation.en: During his time with the team, he scored 403 goals in 468 appearances.
translation.ig: Na oge ya na ndi otu egu ahu, osuiri okpo goolu 403 na mputa 468.

translation.en: No one else has ever made more appearances or scored more goals for the club than Bobek.
translation.ig: O nwebeghị onye ọzọ ọbụla na-agbakarịala bọọlụ maọbụ nyekarịa goolụ n'otu egwuregwu bọọlụ ahụ karịa Bobek.

translation.en: In 1995 he was voted the best player in Partizan's history.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1995 a tụrụ ụtụ chiri ya onye kacha n'egwuregwu n'akụkọ ihe mere eme nke Patizan.

translation.en: The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil.
translation.ig: Ihe e ji bido mmemme bụ ihe ngosi ọpụrụiche nke Sek du Solei, otu a maara aha ha n'ụwa dum, mere.

translation.en: It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses.
translation.ig: Ihe sotere ya bụ Simfoni Ọkestra Steeti Istanbul, Otu egwu ndị Janisrị, na Fatih Erkoç na Müslüm Gürses, ndị abụ abụọ.

translation.en: Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage.
translation.ig: Mgbe ahụ ndị okpukpe ọgba egwu ntụgharị gbogotere n’elu nkwago.

translation.en: Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou.
translation.ig: Onye Tọki diva Sezen Aksu mere emume ngosi ya na onye Itali ahụ tenor Alessandro Safina na ọgụ egwu onye Griik Haris Alexiou.

translation.en: To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show "Troy".
translation.ig: Na ngwụcha, ndị otu igba egwu nke Tọki gosiri ihe ngosi "Troị".

translation.en: Peter Lenz, a 13-year-old motorcycle racer, has died after being involved in a crash at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.
translation.ig: Peter Lenz, onye ọgba ọsọ ọgba tum tum gbara afọ iri na atọ, anwụọla mgbe o sonyere n’ime otu mkpọka na Indianapolis Motor Speedway ahụ.

translation.en: While on his warm-up lap, Lenz fell off his bike, and was then struck by fellow racer Xavier Zayat.
translation.ig: Dị ka ọ ka nọ na laapụ ikpo ahụ ọkụ ya, Lenz dapụrụ n’igwe ya, ma mgbe ahụ a kụrụ ya site n’aka onye ọgba ọsọ ibe ya Xavier Zayat.

translation.en: He was immediately attended to by the on-track medical staff and transported to a local hospital where he later died.
translation.ig: Ndị ọrụ ahụike nọ na trak letara ya ozugbo, e wee buru ya gaa n'ụlọ ọgwụ dị na mpaghara ahụ ebe ọ mechara nwụọ.

translation.en: Zayat was unhurt in the accident.
translation.ig: Zayat ahụghị ihe mberede ahụ.

translation.en: Regarding the global financial situation, Zapatero continued by saying that "the financial system is a part of the economy, a crucial part.
translation.ig: Gbasara onodu ego n’uwa niile, Zapatero n’ekwu si na "usoro eji akpa ego bu otu nkewaputa di n’ime usoro eji akpa aku n’uba, nkewaputa di ezigbo mkpa.

translation.en: We have a year-long financial crisis, which has had its most acute moment in the past two months, and I think now the financial markets are beginning to recover."
translation.ig: Anyi anọọla otu afọ n'ụkọ ego, ọnwa abụọ gara aga bụ oge ọkacha njo, mana echerem na ahịa ego na-agbake."

translation.en: Last week, Naked News announced that it would dramatically increase its international language mandate to news reporting, with three new broadcasts.
translation.ig: N’izu gara aga, Akụkọ Gba ọtọ mara ọkwa na ọ ga-amụba ikike asụsụ mba ụwa ya nye ịkọ akụkọ, ya na mgbasa ozi atọ ọhụrụ.

translation.en: Already reporting in English and Japanese, the global organization is launching Spanish, Italian, and Korean-language programs, for television, the web, and mobile devices.
translation.ig: Ka a na-akọ akụkọ n'asụsụ Bekee na asụsụ Japan ugbua, ụlọọrụ zuzugbe na-amalitebe ihe omume n'asụsụ Spenụ, Itali na Koria, maka televishọn, weebụ, na ngwaọrụ mkpanaka.

translation.en: "Luckily nothing happened to me, but I saw a macabre scene, as people tried to break windows in order to get out.
translation.ig: Isi awele m mere onweghi ihe mere m, mana ahuru m ajoo ihe ebe a, ka ndi mmadu n’akuwasi windo n’acho ka ha ga esi puta.

translation.en: People were hitting the panes with chairs, but the windows were unbreakable.
translation.ig: Ndị mmadụ ji oche na-akụ ndasị ndị ahụ, mana ntapu ndị ahụ ekweghi nkụwa.

translation.en: One of the panes finally broke, and they started to get out by the window," said survivor Franciszek Kowal.
translation.ig: Otu n'ime ndasị ndị ahụ mechara kụwaa, ha wee si na ntapu na-apụ," onye lanarịrị ihe mberede bụ Franciszek Kowal kwuru nke a.

translation.en: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements.
translation.ig: Kpakpando ga na-enyepụ ọkụ na okpomọkụ site n'ike nke na-adị mgbe atọm haịdurojin ga na-amakọta wee mebe elementị ndị ka n'arọ.

translation.en: Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way.
translation.ig: Ndị ọka mmụta sayensị na-arụ ọrụ ịrụpụta igwe si oti ahụ eme ike.

translation.en: This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.
translation.ig: Nke a, otú ọ dị, bụ otu nsogbu tara ezigbo akpụ idozi ma ga-ewe ọtụtụ afọ tupu anyị ahụ fushọn rịaktọ ndị bara uru a rụrụ.

translation.en: The steel needle floats on top of the water because of surface tension.
translation.ig: Agịga igwe n'ese n'elu mmiri n'ihi ike n'arụ ọrụ n'elu mmiri.

translation.en: Surface tension happens because the water molecules at the surface of the water are strongly attracted to each other more than they are to the air molecules above them.
translation.ig: Nsogbu ahụ mere n’ihi na mkpụrụ mmiri ahụ nke mọlekùl dị n’elu mmiri dị ike ma mee ka ndịọzọ karịa ka ha si enweta ihe ikuku dị n’elu ha.

translation.en: The water molecules make an invisible skin on the water’s surface that allows things like the needle to float on top of the water.
translation.ig: Ụmụ irighiri ihe nke mmiri na-eme akpụkpọ na-adịghị ahụ anya n’elu mmiri nke na-eme ka ihe dị ka agịga wee see n’elu mmiri.

translation.en: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted.
translation.ig: Bleedi nọ n'akpụkpọ ụkwụ aịz sketị nke ugbua nwere akụkụ abụọ nke oghere dabara ime dị n'etiti ha. Akụkụ abụọ a na-eme ka o jide aịz nke ọma karịa, ma mgbe o hulatara n'otu akụkụ.

translation.en: Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves.
translation.ig: N'ihi na okpuru agụba ahụ rọrọ arọ nwa obere, ka agụba ahụ na-arọje n'otu akụkụ maọbụ nke ọzọ, akụkụ ahu nke na-emetụ mkpụrụ mmiri ga arọkwa.

translation.en: This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.
translation.ig: Nke a na-eme ka onye na-agba skeeti tụgharịa. Ọ bụrụ na skeeti atụlaga n'aka nri, onye na-agba ya atụlagakwa n'aka nri, ọ bụrụ na skeeti atụlaga n'aka ekpe, onye na-agba ya atụlagakwa n'aka ekpe.

translation.en: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light.
translation.ig: Ma ha chọ ịlaghachi n'ogugo ike ha nọbụ na ya, ha ga ewepụrịrị ike ha natara ọkụ.

translation.en: They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a "photon".
translation.ig: Ha na-eme nkea site na-ịgbasa obere urughuru ọkụ a na akpọ "fotọn".

translation.en: Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation.
translation.ig: Ndị ọkammụta sayensị kpọrọ usoro a "mkpalite mmepụta radiyeshọnụ" maka na ọkụ na-egbuke egbuke na-akpali atọm, nke na-ebute mmepụta ọkụ fotọn, ma ọkụ bụkwa otu ụdị radiyeshọnụ.

translation.en: The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture.
translation.ig: Foto nke na-esote na-egosie ebe ụmụ atọm a na-anyụpụ fotọn gasị. N'ezie, fotọn pere mpe karịa etu i si ahụ na foto a.

translation.en: Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!
translation.ig: Photons dị obere karịa ihe dị n'ime atom!

translation.en: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works.
translation.ig: Ka ọtụtụ narị awa a rụchara ọrụ, filament na ọkụ ahụ mechara gbaa ọkụ ma bọlbụ ọkụ ahụ anaghịzi arụ ọrụ.

translation.en: The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb.
translation.ig: Ugbu a oge e ji agbanwe ọkụ a eruola. Mmadụ aghaghị ịkpachara anya mgbe ọ na-agbanwe ọkụ a.

translation.en: First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected.
translation.ig: Nke mbu, ekwesịrị ịgbanyụ ihe ngbanye ọkụ ma ọ bụ na-ewepụrụ ihe eriri ọkụ ya

translation.en: This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.
translation.ig: N’ihi na oku latrik nke na-abanye na soket ebe akuku bolbu nwere metal na anodu nwere ike inye gi eletrik shok o buru na imetu ime soket ahu aka ma o bu ebe metal ahu di na bolbu mgbe o ka di na soket.

translation.en: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood.
translation.ig: Obi, nke na-agbasa ọbara, bụ akụkụ ahụ kachasị mkpa n'usoro mgbasa ọbara dị n'ahụ mmadụ.

translation.en: Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.
translation.ig: Ọbara na-apụ site n'obi n'ime tuubu ndị a na-akpọ akwara ọbara ma na-alọghachi n’obi mmadụ n’ime tuubu ndị a na-akpọ akwara ọbara. Tuubu ndị kachasị obere ka a na-akpọ kapịlarị.

translation.en: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots.
translation.ig: Eze traịserotọpsụ ga-enweli ike ịgbari ọ bụghị naanị akwụkwọ osisi mana ọbụlagodi mpalaga osisi na mgbọrọgwụ ndị siri ezigbo ike.

translation.en: Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ ndị ọka mmụta sayensị chere na Traịseratọpsụ jiri kaịad, nke bụ ụdị osisi dị ebe nile na Kretashiọs mere nri.

translation.en: These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves.
translation.ig: Osisi ndia ndi yiri oburu obere ukwu nkwu nwere okpu ahihia mpipi, na adu-adu.

translation.en: A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk.
translation.ig: Tụraịserotọpsụ nwere ike bụrụ na ọ na-eji ọnụ mpịa ya siri ike atụchasị akwụkwọ osisi tupu o riwe ogwe osisi ahụ.

translation.en: Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
translation.ig: Ndị ọkammụta ndị ọzọ na-ekwu na ebe osisi ndị a na-ebute ọrịa, ọ dịghị ka daịnosọọ ọbụla ọ tara ha, agbanyeghị na taa ụmụanụmanụ dị ka slọtụ nakwa icheku (nke si n'agbụrụ daịnosọọ) nwere ike iri akwụkwọ nri maọbụ mkpụrụ osisi na-emerụ ahụ.

translation.en: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth.
translation.ig: Kedụ ka ike ndọda nke lo si adọm? Ọbụrụ na ịkwụrụ n'elu lo, Ị ga-ada obere karịa ka Ị si ada n'ụwa anyị.

translation.en: A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.
translation.ig: Onye na-ada paụndụ 200 (kg90) n'ụwa ga-ada ihe dịka paụndụ 36 (kg16) na lo. Ya bụ na  ike ndọda, dịka ọ dị, anaghị adọsi gị ike.

translation.en: The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma.
translation.ig: Anyanwụ enweghị ala kpọrọ mkpọ dị ka Ụwa nke ị nwere ike ịkwụ n’elu ya. Anyanwụ niile bụ ụmụ gaasị, ọkụ, na plasma mejupụtara ya.

translation.en: The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun.
translation.ig: Gaasị ahụ ga-adị gịrịrị ka ị ga-aga site n’etiti anyanwụ.

translation.en: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light".
translation.ig: Mpaghara mputa nkea anyi ahu ma anyi lee Anyanwu anya ka ana akpo photospere, nke putara "bọọlụ nke ọkụ".

translation.en: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does.
translation.ig: Ka e mechara n’ihe dịka afọ puku atọ, na 1610, Onye Itali bụ ọkammuta n'amụmamụ mabaraigwe Galileo Galilei jiri teleskopụ wee nyote na Venus nwere agba ga, dịka ọnwa nwere.

translation.en: Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun.
translation.ig: Usoro feezi na-eme n’ihi naanị akụkụ Venus (ma ọ bụ nke Ọnwa) chewere ihu n’Anyanwụ ahụ mụnyere ọkụ. Usoro feezi nke Venus kwadoro tiori nke Copernicus na ụmụ mbara ala na-agba Anyanwụ gburugburu.

translation.en: Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
translation.ig: Mgbe ahụ, afọ ole na ole gachara na 1639, otu onye Bekee ọkachamara na mbara igwe aha ya bụ Jeremiah Horrocks nyotere otu njem nke Venus.

translation.en: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw.
translation.ig: England enweela udo ogologo oge kamgbe ha merigharị Danelaw n'agha.

translation.en: However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier.
translation.ig: Otu ọ dịna na 991 Etelred buru agha megide ndị agha mmiri Vaịkịn ka nke ọbụla kemgbe nke Gutrum otu narị afọ gara aga.

translation.en: This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination.
translation.ig: Onye isi agha a bụ Olaf Trygvasson, onye obodo Nọọwe onye chọrọ ịnapụta obodo ya n'aka nchịkwa ndị obodo Denmak.

translation.en: After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.
translation.ig: Mgbe ha nwechara ihe ọdachi agha n’isi mbụ, Ethelred kwenyeziri n’usoro nke nkwekọrịta Olaf, onye laghachịrị na Norway iji nwàa iwetaghachi obodo ya n’iji ngwakọrịta ọganiihu.

translation.en: Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450).
translation.ig: Hangeul bụ naanị mkpụrụ edemede a ka na-eji kwa ụbọchị taa nke akpachara anya kepụta. E kepụtara mkpụrụ edemede ahụ n'afọ 1444 n'oge ọchịchị nke Eze Sejong (1418 – 1450).

translation.en: King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded.
translation.ig: Eze Sejong bụ eze nke anọ nke Usoro ndi eze Joseon ma ọ bụkwa otu n’ime ndị a kacha akwanyere ugwu.

translation.en: He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people".
translation.ig: Na mbụ ọ gụrụ akara edemede Hangeul, Hunmin Jeongeum, nke pụtara "ụda kwesịrị maka ntuziaka ndị mmadụ".

translation.en: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them.
translation.ig: Enwere ọtụtụ akụkọ maka etu e si mepụta asụsụ Sanskrit. Otu n'ime ha bụ na o si n'aka ndị Aryan jiiri asụsụ ha si n'ọdịda anyanwụ bata India.

translation.en: Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe.
translation.ig: Sanskrit bụ asụsụ mgbe gboo bụrụkwa nke enwere ike ịtụnyere asụsụ Latịn a na asụ na Yuropu.

translation.en: The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy.
translation.ig: Akwụkwọ mbụ a maara n'ụwa a bụ asụsụ Sanskrit ka e ji dee ya. Mgbe a chịkọtachara Upanishads, asụsụ ndị ọzọ ewere ọnọdụ sanskrit.

translation.en: Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.
translation.ig: Sanskrit bụ asụsụ bara ụba ma dị mgbagwoju anya, nke bụ isi mmalite ọtụtụ asụsụ obodo India taa, dịka Latịn siri bụrụ isi mmalite asụsụ mba Iroopu dịka Frenchị na Spaniishi.

translation.en: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain.
translation.ig: Ebe agha banyere mba France agafela, mba Germany ebido kwadowa maka iba mba-mmiri nke Britain na-ike.

translation.en: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak.
translation.ig: Aha koodu Germany kpọrọ mwakpo ahụ bụ "Operation Sealion". Ọtụtụ ngwa agha na ihe agha ndị agha Britain furu efu mgbe ha siri na Dunkirk pụọ, yabụ na ndị agha adịchaghị ike.

translation.en: But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel.
translation.ig: Ma na ndi agha mmiri mmiri mba Britain ka ndi agha mmmiri ndi Germany ("kriesmarine") were sie ike. ha kara imemina ugbo ala obula ezipuru n’owa bekee.

translation.en: However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
translation.ig: Ma ka o si dị, ụgbọ mmiri agha ole m'ole nọchiri ụzọ dị ka ụzọ mwakpo agha ebe ndị isi agha nọ n'ụjọ na ndị agha ikuku Jamani ga emi ụgbọ mmiri ha.

translation.en: Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "little brother" of Germany and Japan.
translation.ig: Ka anyị bido n’otu nkọwa gnasara atụmatụ nke Itali. Itali bụ tụmadị “obere nwanne nwoke” nke Jamani na Japanụ.

translation.en: It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war.
translation.ig: O nwere ndị agha ala na nke mmiri n’adịghị ike, n’agbanyeghi na ha ka rụchara ụgbọmmiri anọ ọhụụ tupu agha ebido.

translation.en: Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa.
translation.ig: Isi ihe mgbaru ọsọ mba Itali bụ mba Afrịka dị iche iche. Ịnwudo obodo ndị ahụ, ha ga enwe ebe esi ezipu ndị agha, ka ndị agha nwee ike kwọọ ụgbọ kwọfee oke osimiri Mediterenia wee wakpo mba Afrịka.

translation.en: For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else.
translation.ig: N'ihi nke a, ha lara ntọala ndị agha ma ụgbọ mmiri agha mba Briten dị n'obodo Ijipt n'iyi. Ewepụ omume ndị a, ụgbọ mmiri agha ndị Itali ekwesịghị ime ihe ọzọ.

translation.en: Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain.
translation.ig: Ugbua maka Japan. Japan bụbu obodo isuo, dịka Briten.

translation.en: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time.
translation.ig: Ụgbọ okpuru mmiri bụ ụgbọ mmiri arụrụ maka njem n'okpuru mmiri, ma nọrọ ebe ahụ oge tere aka.

translation.en: Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range.
translation.ig: E jiri ụgbọ okpuru mmiri lụọ Agha Ụwa I na Agha Ụwa II. N’oge ahụ ha na-aga nnọọ nwayọ ma nwekwaa ohere ọgbụgba pere mpe.

translation.en: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen.
translation.ig: Na mbido agha ha nọ na-aga naanị n’elu mmiri mana a ihe nnataozi n'ikuku bidoro rụwa ọrụ nke ọma ụgbọokpurummiri enweghizi ihe ọzọ ọ ga-eme n'abụghị ịgbada n'okpuru mmiri ka a ghara ịhụ ya.

translation.en: German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines.
translation.ig: A na-akpọ ụgbọ okpuru mmiri ndị Germany U-Boat. Ndị Germany maara anya ụgbọ okpuru mmiri ha ọfụma

translation.en: Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.
translation.ig: N'ihi ọga n'ihu ha n'iji ụgbọ okpuru mmiri, ka agha gasịrị ndị obodo Jamani abụghị ndị atụkwasịrị obi inwe ọtụtụ n'ime ha.

translation.en: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times.
translation.ig: Ee! Eze Tutankhamun, oge ụfọdụ amaara ya dịka "Eze Tut" maọbụ "Eze nwa", bụ onye eze amaara mgbe ochie n’Egypt n’oge ugbu a.

translation.en: Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists.
translation.ig: O nwere ike ịtụ gị n'anya na ewereghị ya dịka oke mmadụ n’oge ochie nakwa edenyeghị aha ya n’ọtụtụ ndetu aha ndị eze mgbe ochie.

translation.en: However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed.
translation.ig: Ma ka o si dị, nchọpụta ebe olili ya n'afọ 1922 mere ya onye ịrịba ama. Mgbe a na ezu ebe olili mgbe gboo ohi, emetụghị nke a aka.

translation.en: Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ ihe ejiri lie Tụtankamun bụrụ ihe echekwara ọfụma, n'ime ndị a bụ nde kwuru nde ọrụ nka esiri n'ọla dị oke ọnụ ahịa mepụta.

translation.en: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots.
translation.ig: Mmepụta ọtụgharị nwere eze mere ka ụgbọịnyịnya ndị Asịrịa dị ferefere, na-agbalite ọsọ, ma ka dị nkwadebe ịgbakarị ndị agha na ụgbọịnyịnya ndị ọzọ n'ọsọ.

translation.en: Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry.
translation.ig: Uta site na akota ha n’egbu-egbu nwere-ike mifere ngwa-agha ndi agha ndi na emigede ha. ihe dika 1000 B.C., ndi Assyria bu ndi mbu weputara ndi agha n’anya inyanya.

translation.en: A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.
translation.ig: Kalvarị bu ndi agha na-alụ agha ịnyịnya. Emepụtabeghị sadụl mgbe ahụ, ya mere kalvarị Asịrịa busoro agha n'elu azụ ịnyịnya ha.

translation.en: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey.
translation.ig: Anyị maara ọtụtụ ndị ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị, ọka mmụta sayensị, na ndị omenka buụ ndị mba Gris. Onwere ike onye akacha mara aha ya n'omenala a bụ Homa, onye ode abụ kpara ike, onye dere akwụkwọ kacha ibe ya abụọ n'ederede Gris: abụ Iliad na Odisi.

translation.en: Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature.
translation.ig: Sophocles na Aristophanes ka bụ ndị na-egwuri egwu na-ewu ewu ma a na-ewere egwuru egwu ha dị ka otu n'ime ọrụ akwụkwọ kachasị mma n'ụwa.

translation.en: Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.
translation.ig: Onye Griik ọzọ ama ama bụ onye mgbakọ na mwepụ Pythagoras, onye amakarịrị maka tiori ya wuru ewu gbasara ụmụ mmetụta nke akụkụ nke trayangụlụ chewere ihu n’elu.

translation.en: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world.
translation.ig: Amaghị kpọmkwem mmadụ ole na-asụ Hindi. A na-aka na ọ nọ n'etiti ọnọdụ abụọ na anọ n'asụsụ ndị akacha asụ n'ụwa.

translation.en: The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted.
translation.ig: Onu ogugu nwaafọ ndị na-asụ asusu ahụ dịgasị iche na-ndabere na ma ọ bụrụ na aguru ma olumba ndị nwere mmetụta chiri anya.

translation.en: Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language.
translation.ig: Itunye-onu ga adi n’etiti ndi nkwusa nde 340 ruo nde 500, ma ihe ruru nde mmadu 800 nwere ike ighota asusu ahu.

translation.en: Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.
translation.ig: HIndi na Urdu yitere na okwu ma ha di iche n’odide; na mkparita uka nkiti, ndi asu asusu abuo a nwere ike ighota onwe ha.

translation.en: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany.
translation.ig: N'ihe dị ka narị afọ nke iri na ise, Ebe ugwu Estonia hụtara oke mmetụta nke ọdịnala mba Germany.

translation.en: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language.
translation.ig: Ufodu ndi monk ndi Germany choro ka ndi bu nwaafo obodo ruo chukwu nso, ya kpatara ha ji meputa asusu ana akpo Estonian Literal language.

translation.en: It was based on the German alphabet and one character "Õ/õ" was added.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ mkpụrụ edemede Jemani ka elere anya wee mepụta ya ma gbakwunye otu mkpụrụ edemede "Õ/õ".

translation.en: As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
translation.ig: Ka oge gachara, ọtụtụ okwu si n'asụsụ Jamani jikọrọ ọnụ. Nke a bu mbido ọmụma.

translation.en: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school.
translation.ig: N'omenala, onye nketa ocheeze ga aba n'ọrụ onye agha ma ọgụchahaa akwụkwọ.

translation.en: However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree).
translation.ig: Kaosinadị, Charles gara mahadum na Trinity College, Cambridge ebe ọ gụrụ Anthropology na Archaeology, na mgbe e mechara, ọ nwetara akwụkwọ nzụlite 2: 2 (okirikiri nke abụọ).

translation.en: Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.
translation.ig: Charles bụ onye mbụ n’ezinụlọ ọchịchị Britain nke natara digrii ngụcha akwukwo.

translation.en: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country.
translation.ig: Iropian Tọki (ọwụwa anyanwụ Tres maọbụ Rumelia n'ime ala mmiri Balka) so na pasent 3 nke obodo.

translation.en: The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape.
translation.ig: Okeala Turkey karịrị kilomita 1600 (1000 mi) n'ogologo na kilomita 800 (500 mi) n'obosara, ma nwekwaa akụkụ anọ.

translation.en: Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe.
translation.ig: A gụnye ọdọ mmiri ga, mba Tọki nwere nha sụkwịya kilomita 783,562 (sụkwịya maịlụ 300,948), nke sụkwịya kilomita 755,688 (sụkwịya maịlụ 291,773) nọ na ndịda ọdịda anyanwụ Eshia, ma sụkwịya kilomita 23,764 (sụkwịya maịlụ 9174) anọrọ na Yuropu.

translation.en: Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined.
translation.ig: Nha ebe Tọki mere ya mba kachasị ibu n'ụwa nke iri atọ na asaa; ma ọ ha ka ebe e jikọtara ọnụ Obodo Frans Mepere Emepe na United Kingdom.

translation.en: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
translation.ig: Tọkị bụ oke osimiri gbara ya gburugburu n'akụkụ atọ: Oke osimiri Aegean n’ọdịdaanyanwụ, Oke osimiri Ojii n’ugwu na Oke osimiri Mediterranean na ndịda.

translation.en: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839.
translation.ig: Luzembọọgụ nwere ogologo agụgụàlà mana nnwere onwe ya gbara afọ sitere na 1839.

translation.en: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
translation.ig: Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga.

translation.en: Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany.
translation.ig: Luxembourg na-agbalị kwa mgbe ị bụ obodo nọrọ onwe ha mana adakpọ gidere ya ma n’oge Agha Ụwa I na II site n’aka ndị Gamani.

translation.en: In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1957 Lukzembọg sooro na ndị tọrọ ntọala nzukọ amaara ta ka njikọ Iroopu.

translation.en: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village).
translation.ig: Drukgyal Dzong bụ ebe ewusiri ike ebibiri ebibi bụrụkwa ebe obibi ndị mọnk n'efe Buda n'akụkụ elu nke distrikti Paro (n'ime obere obodo Fondi).

translation.en: It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces.
translation.ig: A sị na n'afọ 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel rụrụ ebe mgbaba a iji cheta mmeri ya megide ndị agha Tibetan-Mongol.

translation.en: In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1951, ọkụ ọgbụgba mere ka sọ ihe onwunwe ole m'ole nke Drukgyal Dzong fọ, ihe dị ka onyonyo Zabdrung Ngawang Namgial.

translation.en: After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.
translation.ig: Mgbe ọkụ ahụ rechara, echekwara ma chedo ebe ahụ ewusiri ike, nke fọrọ ịbụ otu n’ime ihe ndọta kachasị emetụta nke Bhutan.

translation.en: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam.
translation.ig: Na narị afọ iri na asatọ, Kambodia hụtara onwe ya n'etiti agbatobi abụọ dị ike, Taịland na Vietnam.

translation.en: The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen.
translation.ig: Ndị Taị lusoro Kambodịa agha ọtụtụ mgbe n’ime narị afọ nke iri na asatọ ma n’ime 1772 ha bibiri Phnom Phen.

translation.en: In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
translation.ig: Na ngwụcha afọ ndị dị na senchuri nke iri na asatọ, ndị Vietnam wakpokwara Kambodia.

translation.en: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy.
translation.ig: Pasentị iri na asatọ nke Ndị Venezuela enweghị ọrụ, ma ọtụtụ n’ime ndị nwere ọrụ na-arụ ọrụ n’ebe ndị n'adabanyeghi n’akụnụba mba.

translation.en: Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture.
translation.ig: Ụzọ abụọ n’ụzọ atọ ndi Venezuela na aru oru na-eme etu ahụ na ngalaba oru, ihe fọrọ obere ka o ruo otu ụzọ n'ụzọ anọ n’ime ulo oru na oru nke ise n'ime oru ugbo.

translation.en: An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
translation.ig: Ụlọọrụ dị mba Venezuela mkpa bụ ụlọọrụ mmanụ, ebe mba ahụ na ebupụ mmanụ n'igwe, n'agbanyeghị na ọ bụ naanị otu pasentị na-arụ n'ụlọọrụ mmanụ.

translation.en: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City.
translation.ig: Na mbụ na nnwereonwe mba ahụ, ọkachamara nke Ubi Botaniik Sịngapọọ nyere ha aka ịgbanwe agwaetiti ahụ ghụọ Obodo Ubi nke ebe okpomọkụ.

translation.en: In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.
translation.ig: Na 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, otu ngwakọ ifuru, bụ nke ahọrọ dị ka ifuru nkeobodo nke mba ahụ.

translation.en: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains.
translation.ig: Kwa ahọ ebe ọnwa Ọktoba, ihe anụ n'eri ahịhịa ruru otu nde n'okara n'aga njem site n'ugwu ruo n'ebe ndịda, gafee mmiri Mara, maka mmiri ozuzo.

translation.en: And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April.
translation.ig: O sizie n'ọdịda anyanwụ laghachi n'ugwu, gafee osimiri Mara ọzọ, mgbe mmiri zochara n'ihe dị ka ọnwa Eprel.

translation.en: The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
translation.ig: Mpaghara Serengeti gụnyere Serengeti Nashọnal Pak, Mpaghara Nchebe Ngorongoro na Maswa Gem Rịzav nọ na Tanzania na Maasai Mara Nashọnal Rịzav na Kenya.

translation.en: Learning to create interactive media requires conventional and traditional skills, as well as tools mastered in interactive classes (storyboarding, audio and video editing, story telling, etc.)
translation.ig: Ịmụta ka esi emepụta ihe mgbasa ozi mmekọrịta chọrọ nka dị iche iche ma ngwa ọrụ amụtara n'ụlọ nkụzi mmekọrịta (ndezi ọdiyo na vidiyo, ịkọ akụkọ n'ihe ndị ọzọ)

translation.en: Interactive design requires that you re-assess your assumptions about media production and learn to think in a non-linear ways.
translation.ig: Nruputa akpariri-akpari ga-acho ka itulegharia uche-obi banyere oru mgbasa-ozi n’ikuku ma muta iche echiche n’uzo na adighi otu.

translation.en: Interactive design requires that components of a project connect to each other, but also make sense as a separate entity.
translation.ig: Ọrụ mkpakọrịta chọrọ ka akụrụngwa nke arụmarụ jikọta onwe ha, ma nweekwa mpụtara ma ha kwụrụ n'onwe ha.

translation.en: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses.
translation.ig: Ihe ọghọm dị na zoom lens bụ na focal complexity ya na ọnụọgụgụ lens elements kwesịrị ka ejiri ya nweta a range of focal lengths karịrị na prime lenses.

translation.en: This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production.
translation.ig: Nke a na-abuzi obere nsogbu maka na ndị na-arụpụta enyoanya enwetala ụkpụrụ dị elu na mmepụta enyoanya.

translation.en: This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length.
translation.ig: Nke a enyela enyoanya mbugharị ohere iji mepụta fòto nke ịdị mma ya bụ nke yiri nke ahụ enyoanya mezuru n'iji ofu etiti nchakwasa.

translation.en: Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower.
translation.ig: Ihe ọghọm ọzọ nke mbugharị ihunyo gasị bụ na oghere nkachasị (èkwòmọsọ ya) nke ihunyo na-adịkarị ala ala.

translation.en: This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.
translation.ig: Nke a na-eme ka o sie iji enyo anya dị ọnụ ala eme ihe n'ebe obere ọkụ dị na-ejighi ọkụ flash.

translation.en: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan.
translation.ig: Otu n’im ensogbu a kacha ahụkarị mgbe a na-anwa ịgbanwe otu ihe nkiri gaa na nhazi DVD bụ nnyocha-keukwuu.

translation.en: Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public.
translation.ig: A na eme igwe onyonyo ka n'ọnụ ọgụgụ otu ọ ga-esi amasị ọha n'eze.

translation.en: For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides.
translation.ig: Maka nke a, ihe niile ihuru na TV ebere oke ya ebe, elu, ala na akuku.

translation.en: This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan.
translation.ig: A na eme ya ka ihe ngosi wee juputa ihuenyo. Nke ahụ ka a na-akpọ ovaskan.

translation.en: Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.
translation.ig: Mana ọ dị mwute na ị mee DVD, oke ya nwere ike ịpụ, ọ bụrụ na ihe ngosi vidiyo ahụ nwere edemede nkọwa nọ n'okpuru ihe ngosi, ọgaghị egosi ha nke ọma.

translation.en: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry.
translation.ig: Kasụl omenala mgbe ochie akpaliela echiche ndị mmadụ ruo oge dị anya, na-etinye n'uche ha oyiyi mmemme añụrị, oriri na nkwari na Atọrịan Shivalrị.

translation.en: Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits.
translation.ig: Ọbụna ma akwụrụ n'etiti mkpọmkpọ ebe nọrọla puku afọ ọ dị mfe itụgharị uche n'ụda ma isi agha a lụrụ oge gara aga, ọ fọdụ obere ịnụ ụda ụkwụ ịnyịnya ma nụkwa isi ụjọ si n'olulu ekuli.

translation.en: But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
translation.ig: Mana echiche anyị ọ dabeere n’eziokwu? Gini mere eji wuo ụlọ kasụl na mbụ? Kedụ otu esi see ma wuo ha?

translation.en: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle.
translation.ig: Áụkarịrị maka oge ahụ, Nnukwu ụlọ Kirby Muxloe dịkarịrị ka ụlọ echekwara echekwa karịa otu nnukwu ụlọ n’ezie.

translation.en: Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long.
translation.ig: Windo ukwu ya e tere ihe na ahụaja ya tara ahụ ekwesịghị inwe ike igbochi otu mwakpo ekpebisiri ike ruo ogologo oge.

translation.en: In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1480 n'ibe ya, mgbe Onye nwe Hastins bidoro ịrụ ya, obodo nọ n'udo ma sọ mgbachite onwe bụ n'imegide obere igwe ndị ohi.

translation.en: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states.
translation.ig: Nhazi ike ọchịchị bụ usoro mba ndị dị na Yuropu gbasoro iji jigide ikike nnọrọonwe nke mba niile dị na Yuropu.

translation.en: The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance.
translation.ig: Echiche butere nke a bụ na obodo Yuropu niile chọrọ ka a ghara inwe otu obodo kacha ibe ya ike, nke a mere ndị isi ọchịchị na-agbanwe njikọ aka ha n'obodo dị iche iche ka ejigide nhazi.

translation.en: The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power.
translation.ig: Agha nnọchiteanya nke mba Spein gosiri agha izi nke nsogbu butere ya bu nhazi ike.

translation.en: This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
translation.ig: Nke a gosipụtara mgbanwe dị mkpa, ka ndị ike mba Iroopu enwezighi ike iji okpukpe eme ihe ngọpụ eji ebido agha. N'ihi nke a, agha alụrụ ahọ iri atọ ga abụ nke ikpeazụ akpọrọ agha okpukpe.

translation.en: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus.
translation.ig: E bibiri ụlọ nsọ nke Artemis nọ na Ephesus na Julaị 21, 356 BCE n’omume ịgba ihe ọkụ nke emere site n’aka Herostratus.

translation.en: According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded.
translation.ig: Dịka akụkọ a si gaa, ihe na-akpali ya bụ etu ọ ga-esi bụrụ onye a maara aha ya, n'agbanyeghi ihe ọ ga-efu. Ndị Efesọs, jiiri iwe maka ya kwubie na agaghị edetu aha Herostratus ma ọlị.

translation.en: The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born.
translation.ig: Strabo onye Gris bụ onye ọkọ akụkọ ihe mere eme mechara detuo aha ahụ, ya mere anyi jiri mara taa. Ebibiri ụlọ okpukpe n'añasị amụrụ Aleksada d Gret.

translation.en: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
translation.ig: Mgbe Alexander bụ eze, ọ sị ka ọ kwụọ ụgwọ ịrụgharị ụlọ nsọ, mana e kweghị. Mgbe Alexander mechara nwụọ, a rụgharịrị ụlọ nsọ na 323 BCE.

translation.en: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers.
translation.ig: Gbaa mbọ hụ n’aka gị na-ezu ike dị ka o kwere omume ma na-akụkwa nootụ ndị ahụ nke ọma - gbalịkwaa ghara emela ọtụtụ mmegharị ahụ na-abaghị uru n’iji ụmụ mkpịsị aka gị.

translation.en: This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano.
translation.ig: Otu a, ike agaghị agwụ gị ọsịsọ. Chetakwa na ọ dịghị mkpa imefu ike n'ịkpa ya aka ka inweta oke olu dịka osi dị na piano

translation.en: On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
translation.ig: N'ụbọ ehwu ahụ, iji nwetakwuo ụhàraụdà, ị ga-eji ọfụ ikuku ndị ahụ n'ijikwu ọkwụkwa ma ọ bụ ekwomọsọ.

translation.en: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God.
translation.ig: Ihe mmụọ bụ ọgịga nke mmekọrịta nwere, njirimara nwere, maọbu ị mara nnụọ na ihe a dị adị, chi, mmụọ eziokwu, maọbụ Chineke.

translation.en: The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties.
translation.ig: Onye ahụ kwenyere na-achọ ahụmihe izi ụzọ, nsinammụọ, ma ọ bụ nghọta n’ime nsiridị Chukwu/chi ahụ ma ọ bụ chi ndị ahụ.

translation.en: Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences.
translation.ig: Ndị na-eso ụzọ na-achụ ụfọdụ ụzọ esi ebi ndụ, ma ọ bụ ụmụ mmewe eburunuche na ọ ga-elekọta anya ahụmihe ndị ahụ

translation.en: Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.
translation.ig: E nwenwuru ike ịmata ihe dị iche na Okwuke Ihe Omimi ya na ụdị okwukwe okpukpe ndị ọzọ na ofufe site na nkwusi ike ya na kpọmkwem ahụmihe keonwe nke otu ọnọdụ pụrụ iche nke nsụhọ, tụmadị ndị nke agwa keudo, kenghọta, na-enye obi ụtọ, ma ọ bụ nke oke obi ụtọ.

translation.en: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition.
translation.ig: Sikizm bụ okpukpe si mba India. O bidoro na mpaghara Pụnjab n'ahọ nke narị iri na ise site na nkesa ngalaba n'etiti omenala Hindu.

translation.en: Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions.
translation.ig: Ndị Sikh ga-agwa gị na okpukpe ha na okpukpe Hindu abụghị otu ihe, mana ha kweere na ọ bụ n'okpukpe Hindu ka nke ha si pụta.

translation.en: Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "way of the guru". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs.
translation.ig: Ndị Sikh na-akpọ okpukpe ha Gurmat, nke pụtara "ụzọ nke guru" na Punjabi. Guru so na ntọala nke okpukpe niile na India mana na Sikhism, ọ biaziri baa uru pụrụ iche nke gbasara isi okwu nke okwukwe ndị Sikh.

translation.en: The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus.
translation.ig: Guru Nanak (1469–1539) bụ onye bidoro okpukpe a n'afọ narị iri na ise. Ndị guru itoolu sotere ya n'azụ.

translation.en: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị, na Juun 1956, ụmụ nkwa Krushchev ka e tinyere n’ule mgbe ọgbaaghara dara na Poland, ebe ndị ọrụ nọ na-eme ngagharị iwe gbasara ụkọ nri na mbelata ụgwọ ọrụ, ghọrọ ngagharị iwe izugbe megide Kọmunizim.

translation.en: Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ eziokwu na na ngwụcha, Krushchev zigara ụgbọ agha igwe ka ha wetaghachi udo, okwenyekwara na ụfọdụ ntuziaka ọchịchọ akụ ma tinyekwa Wladyslaw Gomulka n'oche ọchịchị nke praịm minista.

translation.en: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan.
translation.ig: Mmepeanya Ndagwurugwu Indus bụbu mmepeanya Afọ Ọla na mpaghara ugwu ọdịdaanyanwụ okpuru kọntinent India nke gụnyere ọtụtụ Pakistan nke oge a na mpaghara ụfọdụ na ugwu ọdịdaanyanwụ India na n’ebe ugwu ọwụwaanyanwụ Afghanistan.

translation.en: The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name.
translation.ig: Mmepeanya gara nke ọma n'ụsọ osimiri nke Indus ebe o si nweta aha ya.

translation.en: Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
translation.ig: N’agbanyeghi n’ufodu oka mmuta n’atulee uche na asi n’ebe o bu na mmepeanya di na bezin nke Sarasvati River nke mmiri ya tacha goru, ekwesiri ikpo ya Indus-Sarasvati Civilization ma ufodu n’akpo ya Harappan Civilization na ncheta Harappa, ebe izizi ebu uzo were gwuo n’oge 1920.

translation.en: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances.
translation.ig: Ụdịdị agha nke alaeze Rome nyere aka n'ịkwado ọganihu na ngalaba ahụike.

translation.en: Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles.
translation.ig: Eze gburugburu Ọgọstus bidoro na-ewe ndị dibia n'ọrụ ma bido rịị Roman Medịkal Kọọz nke mbụ ga-arụ ọrụ nlekọta mgbe alụsiri agha.

translation.en: Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds.
translation.ig: Ndị dọkịta na-awa ahụ mabu maka ọtụtụ ọgwụ ụra dịka mọfịịn e si na mkpụrụakụkụ pọpị enweta na skopolamiin e si na mkpụrụakụkụ habenụ enweta.

translation.en: They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow.
translation.ig: Ha bịara dị mma na mbepụ ụkwụ iji chebe ndị ọrịa gangrene yana tourniquets na arterial clamps iji gbochie ọbara ọgbụgba.

translation.en: Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
translation.ig: Dịka ọtụtụ narị afọ gafere, alaeze Rom wetara maka nnukwu uto na ngalaba ọgwụgwọ ma chọpụtakwa ọtụtụ ihe ọmụma anyị maara taa.

translation.en: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations.
translation.ig: Pịọland origami bụ nke nwere iwu mgbochi sị na sọ otu mpịaji ka enwere ike ime kwa mgbe, anaghị anabata mpịaji ndị ka mgbagwoju anya, ma mpịaji nile nwere ọnọdụ were anya.

translation.en: It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ John Smith mepụtara ya n'afọ 1970 ga iji nyere folda ndị na-enweghi ahụmihe aka maọbụ ndị nwere obere nka n'ịnya moto.

translation.en: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior.
translation.ig: Ụmụaka na-ewuli amamihe banyere agbụrụ na ịkpa oke n'ihi ndịiche agbụrụ mgbe ha ka dị obere ma ịkpa oke agbụrụ ndị a na-emetụta akparamaagwa.

translation.en: For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
translation.ig: Iji maa atụ, ụmụaka ndị si agbụrụ nwere ọnọdụ ntakịrị nke a na-ahụta ka ndị na-anaghị eme nke ọma n'ụlọ akwụkwọ ga-ebido mewe njọ n'ụlọ akwụkwọ ozugbo ha matara otu ndị mmadụ si ahụta agbụrụ ha.

translation.en: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently.
translation.ig: MaịSpes bụ webụsaịtị nke ịtọ akacha eji mere ihe na mba Yunaịted Steeti ma onwekwara profaịlụ nde iri ise na anọ ugbua.

translation.en: These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting.
translation.ig: Amasaịba ndị a adọtala mmasị ndị mmadụ ebe ọ dị ukwuu, ọkachasị n'ebe mmụta.

translation.en: There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features.
translation.ig: Enwere uru webụsaịtị ndị a na-aba, dịka peeji klaasị ọhụrụ nke nwere ike ịnwe blọg, vidio, foto, na ihe ndị ọzọ.

translation.en: This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling.
translation.ig: E nwere ike inweta òhèrè ihuakwụkwọ a na mfe site n’inye naanị otu adreesị weebụ, nke na-eme ka ọ dịrị mfe icheta na mfe ịpịnyere ụmụ akwụkwọ ndị nwere ike inwe nsogbu iji ụgbọọtụgwo ahụ ma ọ bụ na nsụpe.

translation.en: It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
translation.ig: E nwere ike ịhazigharị ya ka o nwee ike dị mfe ịgụ nakwa iji nnukwu ma ọ bụ obere agba dị ka achọrọ.

translation.en: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy".
translation.ig: Adịghị otu o kwesiri nke uche, "bụ ọrịa ụbụrụ nke nkọwa agba ochie ya na-egosipụta ihe njirimara ya atọ nke gụnyere inwe mkpalite mberede, mkpafu akọnauche, na imebiga ihe oke maọbụ inwe ike gafere oke".

translation.en: It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children".
translation.ig: Ọ bụghị nkwarụ ọmụmụ ihe, ọ bụ nsogbu mmụta; "ọ na-emetụta ụmụaka ruru pasentị ato ruo ise, onwekwara ike metụtaruo ụmụaka mba Amerịka ruru nde abụọ".

translation.en: Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation.
translation.ig: Ụmụaka n'arịa ọrịa ADD na-enwe nramahụ ịgbado anya n'ihe dịka ọrụ ụlọakwụkwọ, mana ha nwere ike ịgbado anya n'ihe ha n'enwe ọñụ ime dịka egwuregwu m'ọbụ ile onyonyo ụmụaka nke na-amasị ha m'ọbụ ide ihe n'enweghị ntụpọ.

translation.en: These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they "engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods.
translation.ig: Umuaka na abawakari nime otutu nsogbu, nihi na ha "na etinye onwe ha na akparamagwa di-egwu, na aba n’ogu, ma na-ama ikikere ochichi aka n’ihu" ebe ha na acho ikpali uburu ha, ebe-obu na akpaliteli uburu site na uzo esi eme ya.

translation.en: ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different.
translation.ig: ADD na emetuta mmekorita ndi ogbo maka na umuaka ndi ozo agaghi aghota ihe kpatara ha ji eme ka ha si eme, ihe kpatara ha ji asupe ka ha si asupe ma o bu na ntozu oke di iche.

translation.en: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed.
translation.ig: Dịka ikikere ịnweta ihe ọmụma na ịmụta ihe gbanwere etu e gosigoro ebe a, ego ọ na-efu ịmụta ihe gbanwere.

translation.en: The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus.
translation.ig: Usoro e ji echeta ozi dị iche. Ọ bụghịzị ịcheta mmadụ ka onye ọbụla na-ekwu okwu ya, kama ọ bụ ikikere ịcheta edemede ka etinyeziri uche.

translation.en: In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
translation.ig: N’eziokwu, oge renaissance gbanwere etu esi amuta ihe na ka esi agbasa ozi n’uzo puru iche.

translation.en: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees.
translation.ig: N’adịghị ka praịmetị ndị ọzọ, hominids anaghịzi eji aka ha aga-ije ma ọ bụ ibu ihe ma ọ bụ ịwụgharị n’etiti ụmụ osisi.

translation.en: The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking.
translation.ig: Aka na ukwu adaka ahụ yiri na nha na ogologo, na-egosi ojiji aka ya maka ibute ibu nọ n'ime ije njikọ mkpịsịaka.

translation.en: The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges.
translation.ig: Aka mmadụ dị mkpụmkpụ karịa ụkwụ, ya na ụmụ ọkpụkpọ mkpịsị aka kara kwụ ọtụ.

translation.en: Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
translation.ig: Ụmụ ọkpụkpọ aka fosil gbara afọ nde abuo rue nde ato na-ekpughe ngbanwe a na ọkachamara nke aka ahụ site na ngagharị rue mmegharị.

translation.en: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ ndị mmadụ kweere na ịnwe ọtụtụ nrọ nlezianya nke mmadụ kpatara na-agwụ ike.

translation.en: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states.
translation.ig: Ihe kachasị akpata nke a bụ na nrọ ndị ahụ doro anya na-amụba oge dị n'etiti ọnọdụ REM dị iche iche.

translation.en: With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem.
translation.ig: N'ilegharị anya ngwangwa kwa abalị, ọnọdụ a nke ị na-anọ n'ụra n'ezie ma ahụ gị agbakee na-adịkarị obere nke ọ gaghị abụrụ nsogbu.

translation.en: This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV.
translation.ig: Nke a bụ ihe na-agwụ ike dịka ọbụrụ na ị na-etete n'ụra nkeji iri abụọ m'ọbụ atọ ọbụla ile igwe onyonyo.

translation.en: The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
translation.ig: Mmetụta ahụ nọ na ndabere n’ugboro ole ụbụrụ gị na-anwa ịrọ nrọ nke ị mara onwe gị n’ime ya kwa abalị.

translation.en: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya.
translation.ig: Ihe agaghị nke ọma maka ndị Itali n’ime Ugwu Afrịka ọ fọrọ obere ka ọ bụrụ site na mbido. N’ime otu izu nke nkwupụta agha nke Itali na Juun 10, 1940, Hussars nke iri na otu nke ndị Britenụ eweghaara Fort Capuzzo n’ime Libya.

translation.en: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci.
translation.ig: N'agha mberede n'ebe ọwụwa anyanwụ Bardia, ndị Britain jidere n'agha Onye isi Injinia nke Ndị agha Nke iri nke Italy, General Lastucci.

translation.en: On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
translation.ig: Na Juun 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, onyeisiala mba Libya na onye nsote Mussolini nwụrụ site n'ọgbụgba nke ndị otu ya n'amaghị ama ka ọ na-achọ ịkwụsị na Tobruk.

translation.en: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition.
translation.ig: Egwuregwu fensịn nke ọgbọ a bụ nke a na-egwu n'ọtụtụ ogugo, site n'ụmụ akwụkwọ mahadum ruo na ndị ọkachamara n'ịsọmpi olimpik.

translation.en: The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.
translation.ig: A na-egwu egwuregwu ahụ n’isimbụ na nhazi nke asọmpi mmadụ abụọ, otu onye egwuregwu ọgụ mma na-alụsị anye ọzọ.

translation.en: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes.
translation.ig: Gọlf bụ egwuregwu ebe ndị na-agba ya na-eji osisi akụbanye bọọlụ n'oghere dị n'ala.

translation.en: Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth.
translation.ig: A na-egwu oghere iri na-asato na egwuregwu nkiti, ndi egwuregwu n’ebidokari na oghere nke mbu na koosu were mechie na nke iri na-asato.

translation.en: The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins.
translation.ig: Onye okpukpo piara ntakiri stroku ma obu fere klob obere karia mgbe o na agaghari n’ebe egwuregwu bu onye meririnu.

translation.en: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.
translation.ig: A na-agba egwuregwu a n'elu ahịhịa, na a na-eme ahịhịa gbara olulu gburugburu, nke a na-akpọ griin, ka ọ dị mkpụmkpụ karịa.

translation.en: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism.
translation.ig: Ikekwe ụdị njem nlereanya akacha mara bụ ihe ọtụtụ mmadụ na-etinye ya na njem n'otu: Njem ntụrụndụ.

translation.en: This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun.
translation.ig: Nke a bụ mgbe ndị mmadụ na-aga ebe dị iche nke ukwu site n’ebe ha na-ebikarị ndụ ụbọchị-ruo-ụbọchị ha iji zuo ike ma nwee an̄ụrị.

translation.en: Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists.
translation.ig: Ụsọ mmiri nlepu anya, ogige ntụrụndụ na ogige ọnọdụ bụ ebe ndị njem nlegharịanya ntụrụndụ na ejekarị.

translation.en: If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism.
translation.ig: Ọ bụrụ na ebumnuche nke ọbịbịa mmadụ na otu ọ ga - eme bụ ịmara akụkọ ya na ọdịnala ya, a na - akpọ ụdị njem nlere anya dị ka njem nlegharị anya.

translation.en: Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
translation.ig: ndi nje-nlere-anya nwere iga hu otutu ihe putara ihe di iche-iche nke obodo obula maobu ha nwerekwara ike ihoro nnoo  ilekwasi anya n’otu ebe.

translation.en: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements.
translation.ig: Ndị mbịarachịwa, dịka ha hụrụ ihe omume a, kpọkwara maka ndị enyemaka.

translation.en: Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals).
translation.ig: Otu ndị amị gara ikwado ndị nọ n'ihu agha gụnyere regiment mmadụ 200 nke mbụ na nke atọ Niu Hampshire, n'okpuru ọchịchị Kolonel Jọn Stak na Jems Riid (ha abụọ mechara ruo ọkwa Jeneral).

translation.en: Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position.
translation.ig: Ndị nwoke Stark guzoro n'akụkụ nsu n'akụkụ ebe ugwu nke ọkwa Colonist.

translation.en: When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach.
translation.ig: Mgbe ebili mmiri dị ala mepere oghere n'agịga mmiri Mistik n'agịga ugwu ọwụwa anyanwụ nke ala mmiri gbara ogige, ha mere ngwangwa ịgbatị mgbidi ahụ ruo n'ugwu kwụsị n'ọnụ mmiri.

translation.en: Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.
translation.ig: Gridley ma ọ bụ Stark gwunyere otu osisi ọdịka ụzọukwu 100 (m 30) n’ihu mgbaaja ahụ ma nye iwu ka a ghara inwe onye ga-agbanụ ruo mgbe ndị na-agafekarị ebe ahụ gafechara ya.

translation.en: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions.
translation.ig: Atụmatụ Amerịka dabeere na ijikọ aka wakpoo, site n'akụkụ atọ dị iche iche.

translation.en: General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements.
translation.ig: Ọchịagha Jọn Kadwọlda ga ebuso ogige Briten agha mbugharị na Bọdintaụn, ka onwee ike igbochi mkwado ọbụla.

translation.en: General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping.
translation.ig: Onye ọchịagha James Ewing ga-ewe ndị agha narị asaa n’ofe osimiri ahụ na Trenton Ferry, dọnara akwa mmiri ahụ n’ofe Assunpink Creek ma gbochie ndị agha onye iro ọ bụla ịgbalaga.

translation.en: The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.
translation.ig: Isi ndị agha mwakpo nke ụmụ nwoke 2,400 ga-agafe osimiri ahụ maịlị itoolu ugwu nke Trenton, ma mgbe ahụ kpọwanye n’òtù abụọ, otu n’okpuru Greene na otu n’okpuru Sullivan, ka e nwee ike ibuso otu agha tupu chi abọọ.

translation.en: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity.
translation.ig: Ya na ngbanwe site n'ịgba ọsọ nkeji iri na ise ruo ọkara maịlị, mkpa èkwòmọsọ adịzie nnọọ obere ma ntachi obi na-abụ ihe dị oke mkpa.

translation.en: Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards.
translation.ig: Otu okwesiri onye oka-ibe na igba okara-maili, otu nwoke bu onue nwere ike imeri nkeji abuo, ga enweriri oke osiso di nma, mana nnagide ka aga azuriri nime ihe mmeru-ahu obula.

translation.en: Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ ịgba ọsọ n’ofe mba n’oge oyi, ejikọtara ya na ọrụ mgbatị ahụ maka akụkụ ahụ nke elu, bụ njikere kachasị mma maka oge agbamọsọ ahụ.

translation.en: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness.
translation.ig: Sọ oriri na-edozi ahụ agaghị eweta maka arụmọrụ pụrụ iche, mana onwere ike ịmetụta ọdịmma onye egwuruegwu gburugburu.

translation.en: Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.
translation.ig: Idowe ọnọdụ ike nke dị ahụ mma, iñụ mmiri nke ọma, na ịghọta ngalaba dị iche iche dị na mgbakwunye ihe oriri nwere ike inyere ndị egwuregwu aka iwelite arụmọrụ ha ma welitekwa obi ụtọ ha na-enwe n'egwuregwu ahụ.
