translation.en: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate.
translation.ig: Ọsọ na-adịchaghị anya bụ egwuregwu na-anaghị efu ego dị ka ndị ọzọ; mana enwere ọtụtụ nghọtahie gbasara ngwa ole na ole ọ ga-ewe isonye na ya.

translation.en: Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance.
translation.ig: E nwere ike ịzụta ngwa ahịa dịka esiri chọ, mana ọtụtụ n'ime ha ga enwe mmetụta arụmọrụ pere mpe m'ọbụ ha agaghị enwe mmetụta m'ọlị.

translation.en: Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.
translation.ig: Ndị egwuregwu nwere ike nwee mmasị maka otu ngwaahịa, ma ọ bụrụgodi na onweghi uru ọbụla ọ bara.

translation.en: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter.
translation.ig: E nwere ike ịtụle na atọm bụ otu n'ime ihe nkịtị eji ewu ihe niile.

translation.en: Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ ihe dị oke mgbagwoju anya nke mejupụtara na, dịka ihe atụ nke Bohr dị mfe si wee gosi, nuklịọs nọ n'etiti nke ụmụ elektrọn na-agba okirikiri, dịtụ ka ụmụ planet na-agba anyanwụ okirikiri - lee eserese 1.1.

translation.en: The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons.
translation.ig: Neuklọs ahụ bụ ahụ ihe abụọ mejupụtara ya - neutrọn na protọn.

translation.en: Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.
translation.ig: Protọn gasị nwere chaajị eletriki dị ọma ebe nutrọn gasị enweghị chaajị. Elektrọn gasị nwere chaajị eletriki dị ọjọ.

translation.en: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety.
translation.ig: Tupu ị gaa lelee onye e merụrụ, i ga-ebu ụzọ nyochaa gburugburu ebe ihe mere iji hụ maka nchekwa gị.

translation.en: You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags.
translation.ig: Ikwesiri ịmara ọnọdụ onye ihe metụtara ka ị na eru ya nso ya na ihe ịdọ aka na ntị ọbụla.

translation.en: If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.
translation.ig: Ọ bụrụ na ị merụọ ahụ ebe ị na-achọ ịnye aka, ị ga-eme ka ihe dịwanye njọ naanị.

translation.en: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers.
translation.ig: Ọmụmụ ahụ chọpụtara na ịda mba, ụjọ na ị na-eche ihe mbibi banyere n’etiti mmetụta nke ụfụ na ndị na-arịa onwunwe nkwarụ n’ụfụ ala azụ

translation.en: Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions.
translation.ig: Ọ bụghị egwu maọbụ ịda mba, kama ọ bụ naanị mmetụta nke iwebiga ihe ọjọọ karịa oke ka nnọkọta PA ahaziri ahazi kwa izu na-akpata.

translation.en: Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.
translation.ig: Ndị na-eme emume site na mgbe ruo na mgbe chọrọ enyemaka karịa n'ogbe inwe mmetụta ụfụ ekwesịghị, ịkọpụta ọdịiche dị n'etiti mgbu alaghịala na mmekpaahụ, mmetụta na mmegharị ahụ nkịtị.

translation.en: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes.
translation.ig: Ọhụhụ, ma ọ bụ enwemike ịhụ dabere na ọganụ ahụ kesensọ sistemụ ọhụhụ ma ọ bụ anya. eyes.

translation.en: There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism.
translation.ig: E nwere ọtụtụ ọrụrụ nke anya dị iche iche, sitere na ọdịdị nke dabere na ọcịchọ nke ihe ahụ dị ndụ.

translation.en: The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.
translation.ig: Ihe dị iche iche a na-arụ nwere ikike dị iche iche, na-enwe mmetụta dịgasị iche iche na akwara ha di na ogo di iche, ha na-ejikwa nhazi dị iche iche iji mepụta echiche nke ntinye ahụ na ọnụọgụ dị iche iche iji rụọ ọrụ ọfụma.

translation.en: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area.
translation.ig: Pọpụleshọn bụ nchịkọta ihe nwere otu ụdị n'ebe ọbụla ekepụtara.

translation.en: When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic.
translation.ig: Mgbe mmadụ nile n'otu ọnụ ọgụgụ nwere otu ihe metụtara otu omume phenotypic ahụ, a maara ha dịka monomorphic.

translation.en: When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.
translation.ig: Mgbe ndị mmadụ na-egosi ọtụtụ ụdị nke otu agwa kpọmkwem ha bụ polimọfik.

translation.en: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well.
translation.ig: Ndị agha ndanda na-aga njem na-akwụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

translation.en: In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day.
translation.ig: N'oge ngagharị n'uto ha, ụmụ agbụsị na-agagharị n'abalị ma na-anọ otu ebe n'ụbọchị.

translation.en: The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday.
translation.ig: Òtù anụmanụ ahụ na-amalite usoro nwagharị mgbe nri dị adị gbadatara. N’oge usoro a, ò̀tù anụmanụ ahụ na-eme akwụ nwa oge nke a na-agbanwe kwa ụbọchị.

translation.en: Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.
translation.ig: Nke ọbụla n'ime ngagharị ike maọbụ ije ndị a na-aga n'ihu ruo abalị 17.

translation.en: What is a cell? The word cell comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning "small room", and it was first coined by a microscopist observing the structure of cork.
translation.ig: Gịnị bụ seelụ? Mkpụrụ okwu ahụ sitere na ọnụokwu Latịn nke bụ "sela", nke pụtara "obere ụlọ", ọ bụ onye nyocha nje nke anya anaghị ahụ anya bu ụzọ kpọọ ya aha ahụ mgbe ọ na enyocha nhazi mpe mpe osisi.

translation.en: The cell is the basic unit of all living things, and all organisms are composed of one or more cells.
translation.ig: Mkpụrụ ndụ bụ isi nkeji nke ihe niile dị ndụ, na ihe niile dị ndụ bụ otu mkpụrụ ndụ ma ọ bụ karịa mejupụtara ha.

translation.en: Cells are so basic and critical to the study of life, in fact, that they are often referred to as "the building blocks of life".
translation.ig: Mkpụrụ ndụ dị oke mkpa na ọmụmụ gbasara ndụ, n’ezie, a na-akpọkarị ha “ntọala obibi nke ndụ”.

translation.en: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed.
translation.ig: Sistemụ Irighiri Akwara na-ejisi homeostasis ike site na izipu mkpali akwara gazuru ime ahụ niile iji mee ka ọbara na-asọ nke ọma yana enweghi nsogbu.

translation.en: These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.
translation.ig: Enwere ike iziga mmetụta akwara ndị a ngwa ngwa ruo ahụ niile nke na-enye aka ịchekwa ahụ n'ihe egwu ọbụla.

translation.en: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path.
translation.ig: Ajọọ ifufe Tonedo na-efetu obere ebe ma ịtụnyere ya na ajọọ ifufe ndị ọzọ, mana ha nwere ike imebi ihe niile nọ n’ụzọ ha.

translation.en: Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours.
translation.ig: Ajọ ifufe na efolite osisi, tirie ulo, ma felie ụgbọala n'ime igwe. Ajọ ifufe ndị kacha njọ bụ pasentị abụọ na-anọ karịa awa atọ.

translation.en: These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
translation.ig: Ikuku oke ifufe ndị a na-erucha 480 kilomita kwa awa (133 maịlụ kwa nkeji; 300 maịlụ kwa awa) n'ọsọ.

translation.en: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years.
translation.ig: Mmadụ anọwo na-eme ma na-eji anụ anya dị elu maka ọtụtụ puku afọ na puku afọ.

translation.en: However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century.
translation.ig: Kaosinadị, ezi teliskop izizi ndị ahụ bụ ndị e mepụtara na Yurop na ngwụsị narị afọ nke iri na isii.

translation.en: These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
translation.ig: Teliskop ndị a jiri njiko ihe onuonyo abụọ ime ka ihe dị anya dị ka ọ dị nso ma ma buo ibu.

translation.en: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly
translation.ig: Anya ukwu na ọchịchọ onwe naanị ga adịgide n'etiti anyị ma ọbụkwa ihe na-esote imekọ ihe ọnụ na mgbe ndị ka n'ọnụ ọgụgụ ritere uru, a ga enwerịrị ihe nrite n'uru dị nụ nke a ga eritenwu n'obere oge ma akpaa agwa ọchịchọ onwe naanị.

translation.en: Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.
translation.ig: A na-ele anya na ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ga-achọpụta na ihe kaara ha mma, maka ogologo mgbe, bụ ịrụkọ ọrụ ọnụ.

translation.en: Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant.
translation.ig: Otutu mmadu n’aro nro otu ubochi mgbe mmadu ga ejenjem na kpakpando ozo ma kwa choputa maka uwa ozo, ufodu ndi mmadu n’aju gini di ebe ahu ufodu kwetere na ndi obia ma obu ndu ozo nwere ike ibi na uwa ndi ozo.

translation.en: But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are "neighbors".
translation.ig: Mana, ọ bụrụ na nke a mee mgbe ọ bụla o nwere ike ọ gaghị eme ọzọ ruo ogologo oge. Kpakpando ndị ahụ kesara nke ukwuu ebe ahụ nke mere na ọ dị maịlị ọtụtu puku ijeri n’etiti kpakpando ndị bụ “agbata obi”.

translation.en: Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?
translation.ig: Ikekwe otu ụbọchị ụmụ ụmụ ụmụ gị ha ga na-ebi n'ụwa gbanwere agbanwe na-eche maka ihe ndị nna nna ha dị ka?

translation.en: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ seelụ bụ ihe mejupụtara anụmanụ. Ha na-eri ihe ma gbazee ha n'ime. Anụmanụ ndị ka n'ọnụ ọgụgụ nwere ike ịga ije.

translation.en: Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains).
translation.ig: Sọ anụmanụ nwere ụbụrụ ( kama ọbụghị anụmanụ nile; jelifish bụ ọmụma atụ nke a).

translation.en: Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.
translation.ig: A ga ahụta anụmanụ gburugburu ụwa nile. Ha na-egwu ala, gwuo mmiri n'oke osimiri, ma fekwaa n'ikuku.

translation.en: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism.
translation.ig: Sel bụ ihe nhazi na ihe na-arụ ọrụ nke kachasị ntakịrị n'ihe ọbụla dị ndụ.

translation.en: Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room.
translation.ig: Seelụ si n'okwu Latịn bụ sela nke pụtara obere ụlọ.

translation.en: If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls.
translation.ig: I nyochaa ihe dị ndụ n'okpuru maịkroskopu, ị ga ahụta ọtụtụ obere bọọlụ.

translation.en: Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope.
translation.ig: Robert Hooke, ọka mmụta ihe banyere ndụ si na Ịnglandị, hụrụ obere ǹkomgbaànoǹhà n’ime okwuchi n’iji otu mikroskopu.

translation.en: They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells
translation.ig: Ha dị ka obere ụlọ. Ya bụ onye mbụ nyochara seelụ nwụrụ anwụ.

translation.en: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change.
translation.ig: Ihe njiama ga na kọmpandù nwere ike isi n'otu steeti gaa n’ọzọ n’enweghị agbanwe.

translation.en: Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same.
translation.ig: Nitrogen dika ikuku nwekwara otu udi akparamaagwa ka Nitrogen dika mmiri. Nke mmiri ya ka di aru mana kpuru ya bukwazi otu ihe ahu.

translation.en: Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
translation.ig: Mmiri bụ ọmụmaatụ ọzọ. Atọm haịdrojin abụọ na otu atọm ọksigin bụ ihe mebere mmiri.

translation.en: It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid.
translation.ig: O nwere otu ụdị ọdịdị nke mọlekụụlụ n’agbanyeghị na ọ bụ ikuku, mmiri, ma ọ bụ ihe siri ke.

translation.en: Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.
translation.ig: N'agbanyeghi na mpụta ihe ya nwere ike ịgbanwe, ọnọdụ kemịkal ya na-anọkwa etu ọ dị.

translation.en: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand.
translation.ig: Oge bụ ihe nọ anyị niile gburugburu, ma na-emetụta ihe niile anyị na-eme, mana ọ na-ara ahụ ịghọta.

translation.en: Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years.
translation.ig: Ndị ọkachamara okpukpe, echiche, na sayensị a mụọla oge ruo ọtụtụ puku afọ.

translation.en: We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past.
translation.ig: Anyị na-enwe ahụmihe oge dị ka ụmụ usoro emume na-agafe site n’ọdịnihu gafere oge ugbu a garuo n’oge gara aga.

translation.en: Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events.
translation.ig: Oge bụkwa etu anyị si atule oge (ogologo) mmemme gasị.

translation.en: You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.
translation.ig: Ị nwere ike ịka ngafe nkke oge n’onwe gị site n’ileru anya mmegharị ọzọ nke otu emume saịklikalụ. Emume saịklikalụ bụ ihe na-eme ugboro ugboro oge niile.

translation.en: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos.
translation.ig: Eji igwe komputa taa emeghari ihe onyonyo foto na nke vidio.

translation.en: Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films.
translation.ig: E nwere ike iwube ntinyendụ ọkaibe gasị n'ụmụ kọmpụta, a na-ejiwanye ụdị ntinyendụ a na telivishọn na ụmụ ihe nkiri.

translation.en: Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.
translation.ig: A na-edekọkarị egwu n’iji kọmputa ọkaibe iji hazie ma wụrikọta ụda ọnụ.

translation.en: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas.
translation.ig: N’otu ogologo oge n’ime ụmụ narị afọ iri na itoolu na iri abụọ, e kwenyere na ndị mbụ biiri na Niu Ziilandị bụ ndị Maori, ndị chụrụ nta nnukwu nnụnnụ a kpọrọ moas.

translation.en: The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society.
translation.ig: Nkwuwe okwu ahụ wee guzobe exhiche ahụ nke sịrị na ndị Maori si Polinesia kwagharịa n'igwe were n'apụ ndị Moriori obodo Niu Ziland, were guzobe ọha mmadụ na-arụ ọrụ ugbo.

translation.en: However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture.
translation.ig: Mana, ihe akaebe ọhụrụ na-egosi na ndị Mariori bụ otu ndị Maori ndị si na Niu Ziland pụọ gaa n'Agwaetiti Chatham, kepụta omenala udo nke ha di iche.

translation.en: There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand.
translation.ig: Enwekwaziri agburu ozo no mba-mmiri nke Chatham ndia bu Maori bu ndi sitere na mba New Zealand.

translation.en: They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
translation.ig: Ha kpọrọ onwe ha Moriori e nwere ọgụ ole na ole ma na ngwụcha ya, e kpochapụrụ Moriori ahụ

translation.en: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures.
translation.ig: Ndị mmadụ ndị o metụtara kemgbe ọtụtụ afọ iri nyere anyị aka inye ike anyị ekele na ọchịchọ obi anyị dị ka a na-enyocha n’eziokwu ụmụ ihe isi ike nakwa ọdịda.

translation.en: While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization.
translation.ig: Ka anyị na-ege ndị mmadụ nti ka ha na akọpụta akụkọ ha, ezinụlọ ha na njikọ aka ha, anyị mụtara ihe nke ukwu gbasara oge gara aga makwa ụfọdụ ndị mmadụ ama ama metụtara omenala nzukọ ahụ nke ọma maọbu nke ọjọọ.

translation.en: While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ eziokwu na ịghọta ihe mere abụghị mmadụ ịghọta omenala, mana ọ na-enyere ndị mmadụ aka ma enweghi ihe ọzọ ịmatatu ebe ha dabanyere n’ime ihe mere nke ụlọọrụ ahụ.

translation.en: While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization.
translation.ig: Ka a na eleba anya n'ọganihu ndị ahụ ma na-enwekwa owuweanya ọdịda, ndị mmadụ na achọpụta n'ụzọ kara mie emi ụkpụrụ, ozi na ihe nkwado nzukọ ahụ.

translation.en: In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church.
translation.ig: N’ọnọdụ a, icheta mgbe ndị mmadụ mere ihe n'ụzọ na-abụghị omenala na otu o si wee rụpụta ihe ọma mere ka ndị mmadụ dị nnabata nye mgbanwe ọhụrụ na ntụzịaka ọhụụ maka ụka obodo.

translation.en: Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
translation.ig: Akụkọ ọganihu dị otu a weturu egwu ihe ntụgharị, ma mekwaa ka enwee olileanya di mma n'ebe mgbanwe dị n'ọdị n'ihu.

translation.en: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution.
translation.ig: Ụkpụrụ ntụgharị uche na-atụ aka ofu ebe bụ usoro esi edozi nsogbu nke na-ejikọ echiche dị iche iche were nweta azịza.

translation.en: The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information.
translation.ig: Ebe udi uche a gbadoro anya bu na ime ngwa ngwa, ezi uche na izi ezi nakwa ichoputa nijirimara ihe mere eme, itinyeghari usoro di adi, ichikota ozi.

translation.en: The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong.
translation.ig: Ihe kachasị mkpa n'ụdịrị echiche a bụ: enwere naanị otu ụsa. Sọọsọ ihe abụọ ị ga na-eche bụ: ọ bụ ya ka ọ bụghị ya.

translation.en: This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures.
translation.ig: A na-ele ụdịrị echiche a anya dịka ihe ụfọdụ ezi usoro maọbụ usoro sayensị.

translation.en: People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
translation.ig: Ndị nwere ụdịrị ezi echiche a na-enwe ike ibu usoro n'isi, dozie nsogbu ma rụọ ọrụ n'ule sayensị gasị.

translation.en: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others.
translation.ig: Ndị mmadụ bụ okike kachasị tozuo oke n'ịchọpụta ebumnuche ndị ọzọ.

translation.en: That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire.
translation.ig: Nke a pụtara na anyị nwere ike ịkọ ihe ndị mmadu ọzọ na-ahụta, chọrọ ime, kweere, maara maọbu nwere mmasi na.

translation.en: Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions.
translation.ig: N'ime ikikere a niile, ọ dị nnọọ mkpa ịghọta ebumnuche ndị ọzọ. Ọ ga-enye anyị aka ka anyị ghara ịghọtahie omume ha.

translation.en: For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car.
translation.ig: N'ọmụmatụ, ọbụrụ na Ị hụ ka mmadụ na akụwa mgbupu ụgbọala, Ị nwere ike izube na ọ chọrọ izu ụgbọala mmadụ.

translation.en: He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.
translation.ig: Ọ ga-ekwesị ka e kpee ya ikpe iche ọ bụrụ na ọ tufuru igodo ụgbọ ala ya ma ọ bụrụkwa ụgbọ ala nke ya ka ọ na-achọ itibanye n’ime ya.

translation.en: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University).
translation.ig: MRI dabeere na Nuklia Magnetik Rezonans (NMR) na fiziks, nke Felix Bloch (na-arụ ọrụ na Mahadum Stanford) na Edward Purcell (si na Mahadum Havad) chọpụtara n'afọ 1930 ga.

translation.en: In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals.
translation.ig: Na rezọnansị a, fild ndọta na ifufe redio na-akpata ụmụ atọm inyefụ ụmụ ntakịrị mgbaama redio.

translation.en: In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1970, Remond Damadian, bụ dibia bekee na onye nchọpụta ihe sayensị, chọpụtara ntọala iji osise foto magnetik rezonans mere ngwa ọrụ dibia bekee eji enyocha ahụ.

translation.en: Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI.
translation.ig: Afọ anọ gachara e nyere otu patentị, nke bụ patentị mbụ n’ụwa enyere na fịịldị nke MRI.

translation.en: In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1977, Dkt. Damadian rụchara igwe nnyocha MRI "nke ahụ niile", nke ọ kpọrọ "Indọmitebul".

translation.en: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others.
translation.ig: Mkparịtaụka anaghị emekọta otu oge na-akwalite iche echiche ma zaghachi ndị ọzọ.

translation.en: It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information.
translation.ig: Ọ na enye ụmụ akwụkwọ ohere ka ha rụọ ọrụ ka osi dị ha mma ka ha nwee njikọ n'ebe ozi nkuzi dị.

translation.en: In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998)
translation.ig: Na mgbakwunye, e nwere mgbochi oge kara dị ole na ole ya na ịpụ omume nke ụmụ oge ọrụ enwere ike ịgbanwe. (Bremer, 1998)

translation.en: The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times.
translation.ig: Iji ịntanetị mere ihe na-ekwe ka ndị na-achọ ịmụta ihe nwee ohere inweta ozi mgbe nile.

translation.en: Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
translation.ig: Ụmụ akwụkwọ na-enye ndị nkụzi ajụjụ oge ọbụla n'ụbochị ma nwee olileanya inweta nzaghachi ọsịsọ, karịa iche mgbe ha hụrụ ihu n'ihu.

translation.en: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn.
translation.ig: Usoro mmụta nke agba ochie na-enye ohere ịmụta ihe site n'ụzọ ọbụla. E nweghi otu ụzọ ka mma isi mụta ihe.

translation.en: In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented.
translation.ig: N'eziokwu, onweghi otu ihe dị mma ọmụmụ. Ọmụmụ bụ ihe na-eme mgbe onye na-amụ ihe na ihe ọmụma nwere mmekọ.

translation.en: Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point.
translation.ig: Ahụmahụ anyị nwere ugbu a na 'ime-ya-n’onwe gị' na ihe niile ị na-egosi, telivishọn mmụta na-akụzi na-egosipụta isi okwu a.

translation.en: So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ n’ime anyị na-ahụ onwe anyị na-ele otu ihe ngosi televishọn na-agwa anyị maka otu usoro ma ọ bụ ahụmihe n’ime nke anyị agaghịrị esonye ma ọ bụ tinye ihe ọmụma ahụ n’ọrụ.

translation.en: We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
translation.ig: Anyị agaghị anwa ịtọpụghasị otu ụgbọ ala, rụọ otu isi iyi n’azụ ụlọ anyị, gaa njem na Peru iji nyochaa ndị mkpọmkpọ ebe ochie, ma ọ bụ mezigharịa ụlọ agbatobi anyị.

translation.en: Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access.
translation.ig: Ekele dịrị ọwa nkwurita okwu ruru Yuropu na ihe mgbasa ozi ikuku, Grinlandị bụ ebe ya na ndị bi na ya ruru pasenti iri itoolu na atọ nwere ezigbo njikọ sitere n'ịntanetị.

translation.en: Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi.
translation.ig: Ụlọ nkwari akụ gị maọbụ ndị nnabata gị (ọ bụrụ na ị nọ n'ụlọ nkwari akụ maọbu ụlọ konwe) nwere ike inwe igwe kọmputa keonwe nwere waịfaị maọbụ njikọ ịntaneetị, ebe obibi niile nwere ọnọdụ ịntaneetị maọbụ waịfaị dịịrị ọha.

translation.en: As mentioned above, though the word "Eskimo" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada.
translation.ig: Dịka e si kwuo n'elu, n'agbanyeghi na a ka nabatara okwu a bụ "Eskimo" na Amerịka, ọtụtụ ndị Aktiki n'abụghị ndị Amerịka ọ kachasị na Kanada hụtara ya dịka mkparị.

translation.en: While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners.
translation.ig: N’agbanyeghị na ị nwere ike ịnụ Ndị mba Griinlandị iji mkpụrụokwu a, ojiji ya kwesịrị ịbụ nke ndị mba ọzọ ga-ezere.

translation.en: The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland.
translation.ig: Ndị obodo bi na Greenland na-akpọ onwe ha Inuit na Kanada na Kalaalleq (nke karịrị otu Kalaallit), onye Greenland, n’ime Greenland.

translation.en: Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no "rough areas."
translation.ig: Mpụ, na ịnwe atụmatụ ọjọọ megide ndị ala ọzọ, anaghị eme na Greenland chaachaa. Ma n'obodo ha, enweghị "ogbe isi mgbaka."

translation.en: Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face.
translation.ig: Oyi bụ sọ ihe ize ndụ ndị na-adịghị njikere ga agabiga.

translation.en: If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing.
translation.ig: Ị gaa ileta Grinland n'oge oyi (itinye n'uche na ka ị na agbago ugu, ka oyi na akarị), ọ dị mkpa iji akwa nchụ oyi.

translation.en: The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues.
translation.ig: Oke ogologo ụbọchị nọ n’oge ọkọchị nwere ike ibute nsogbu inweta ụra zuru ezu na ụmụ nsogbu ahụike metụtaranụ.

translation.en: During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating.
translation.ig: N'oge sọma, kpachara anya maka ụmụ anwụnta nọdik. Ọ bụ eziokwu na ha anaghị ebufe ọrịa ọbụla, mana ha nwere ike ịmekpa mmadụ ahụ.

translation.en: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified.
translation.ig: N'agbanyeghi na ego obodo San Fransisko si na ya ịbụ obodo nlereanya, ụzọ nweta ego ya bara ụba.

translation.en: The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism.
translation.ig: Ngalaba ndị kachasị ewe ndị mmadụ n'ọrụ bụ ejemozi ọkachamara, gọọmenti, akụ, ahịa, na njem.

translation.en: Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world.
translation.ig: Ngosipụta ya ugboro ugboro n’egwu, ihe nkiri, edemede na omenaala ama ama nyere aka mee ka amata obodo ahụ na ihe nhụmaama ya n’ụwa niile.

translation.en: San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities.
translation.ig: San Francisco emepụtala nnukwu akụrụngwa ndị njem nleta ya na ọtụtụ ụlọ nkwarị akụ, ụlọ nri gasị, na ebe ọgbakọ mmemme dị ezigbo mma.

translation.en: San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.
translation.ig: San Fransisko so n'ebe kachasị mma iri nri ndị mba Eshia n'obodo: Nke mba Koria, Taị, India na Japaanụ.

translation.en: Traveling to Walt Disney World represents a major pilgrimage for many American families.
translation.ig: Ịga Wọlt Dizni na-egosipụta oke njem n'ebe ọtụtụ ezinụlọ mba Amerika nọ.

translation.en: The "typical" visit involves flying into Orlando International Airport, busing to an on-site Disney hotel, spending about a week without leaving Disney property, and returning home.
translation.ig: Nleta "nkịtị" ahụ na-agụnye ifeba n'Ọdụ Ụgbọ Elu Ụwa Nile Nke Ọlando, baa bọọsụ gaa n'Ụlọ Nkwari Akụ Dizni nọ n'ebe mepere emepe, nọọ ihe dị ka otu izu na-apụghị n'ala Dizni, ma wee laghachi ụlọ.

translation.en: There are infinite variations possible, but this remains what most people mean when they talk of "going to Disney World".
translation.ig: Enwere otutu ihe di iche iche o nwere ike i bu mana nke a bu ihe otutu mmadu bu n’obi ma ha n’ekwu maka “i ga Uwa Disney”.

translation.en: Many tickets sold online through auction websites such as eBay or Craigslist are partially used multi-day park-hopper tickets.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ akwụkwọ njem a na-ere n'ikuku n'ebe dịka eBay maọbụ Kraigslist bụ ndị ejitụrụ mee ihe.

translation.en: While this is a very common activity, it is prohibited by Disney: the tickets are non-transferable.
translation.ig: N’agbanyeghi na otutu ndi mmadu n’eme ya , Disney anaghi ekwe: i gaghi enye onye ozo tiketi gi.

translation.en: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit.
translation.ig: Njem ọnụnọ ọbula a na-eme n'okpuru ọnụ Gụrandị Kenyọnụ kwesịrị ka onye njem nwee nkwado imeobodo.

translation.en: Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month.
translation.ig: Ikikere nwedebere ike ichekwa ndida ahu, ma diri-adi na ubochi mbu nke onwa, onwa ano tupu mbido onwa ahu.

translation.en: Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan.
translation.ig: Ya bụ na ikike azụụlọ maka ụbọchị mbido ọbụla na Mee ga-adị na Jenụwarị 1.

translation.en: Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations.
translation.ig: Ohere maka ebe ndị a kacha mara ama, dịka Ala kampụ Bright Angel chewere ihu n’akụkụ Ebe a na-azụ ụmụ anụmanụ Phantom, na-ejukarụ n’ọnụ site n’arịrịọ anatara n’ụbọchị mbụ ha mepere nye ndopụta.

translation.en: There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.
translation.ig: Enwere oke nye akwụkwọ ikike nkwado maka njem nkwugharị nke a na enye ndị bu ụzọ bịa.

translation.en: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes.
translation.ig: Iji ụgbọ ala abanye na Ndịda Afrịka bụ ụzọ dị ịtụnanya iji hụ mma mpaghara ahụ niile yana ịbanye ebe ndị na-adịghị n'ụzọ a na-esikarị eme njem nlegharị.

translation.en: This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4.
translation.ig: Enwere ike ime nke a na moto nkịtị ma a kpachara anya tụọ atụmatụ mana ọ ga-aka nnọọ mma iji moto nwere ohere wiili 4x4, nakwa ọ bụ naanị ụdịrị moto a nwere ike ịbanye ụfọdụ ebe.

translation.en: Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are.
translation.ig: Dịka ị na-atụ atụmatụ, buru n'uche na ọ bụghị obodo niile gbara Sawụt Afrịka gburugburu kwụsiri ike dịka ha.

translation.en: Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from.
translation.ig: Ihe ọchụchọ na Visa na-adà ọnụahịa dị iche site na mba ruo na mba ma metụta kwa site n’obodo i siri bịa.

translation.en: Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.
translation.ig: Mba ọbụla nwekwara iwu pụrụ iche nke na-ekwu ngwa mberede nke aghaghị idi n'ụgbọala.

translation.en: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana.
translation.ig: Victoria Falls bụ obodo nọ n'akụkụ ọdịda anyanwụ Zimbabwe, ma agafee oke obodo site na Livingstone, Zambia, na nsonso Botswana.

translation.en: The town lies immediately next to the falls, and they are the major attraction, but this popular tourist destination offers both adventure seekers and sightseers plenty of opportunities for a longer stay.
translation.ig: Obodo ahụ nọ ozugbo n’akụkụ iyi si ugwu awụpụta, ma ha bụ nnukwu ihe ndọta, mana ebe njem nleta a ama ama na-enye ma ndị na-achọ njem ma ndị bịara elekiri ihe ọtụtụ ohere maka ịnọkwu.

translation.en: In the rainy season (November to March), the water volume will be higher and the Falls will be more dramatic.
translation.ig: N’oge udu mmiri (Nọvemba ruo Maachị), ibu mmiri ahụ ga-akarịkwu ma Ozizo mmiri ga-esikwa ike.

translation.en: You are guaranteed to get wet if you cross the bridge or walk along the trails winding near the Falls.
translation.ig: Ekwela nkwa na ị ga-enwe mmiri ma ọ bụrụ na ị gafee àkwà mmiri ma ọ bụ na-aga n'okporo ụzọ ndị na-aga n'okporo ụzọ Mmepe.

translation.en: On the other hand, it is precisely because the volume of water is so high that your viewing of the actual Falls will be obscured—by all the water!
translation.ig: N'aka nke ọzọ, ọ bụ kpomkwem n'ihi na ụhàraòhèrè mmiri dị oke elu nke na nlele gị nke Mmiri na-asọ asọ n'ezie bụ ihe ọ ga-ekpuchi—site n'aka mmiri ahụ niile!

translation.en: Tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 may be the most famous of the tombs in the Valley, the scene of Howard Carter's 1922 discovery of the almost intact royal burial of the young king.
translation.ig: Ebe olili Tụtankamun (KV62). KV62 nwere ike ịbụ ebe olili akacha mara aha ya na-ndịda, ebe Hawọd Kata chọpụtara ebe olili a na emetụghị aka nke eze nwata n'afọ 1922.

translation.en: Compared to most of the other royal tombs, however, the tomb of Tutankhamun is barely worth visiting, being much smaller and with limited decoration.
translation.ig: E jiri ya tulee ili eze ndị ọzọ, o nweghi ihe mmadụ na-aga ịhụ n'ili Tutankhamun; o pere mpe karịa ma nwekwaa obere ịchọ mma karịa.

translation.en: Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage to the mummy done during attempts to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible.
translation.ig: Onye-obula nwere mmasi ihu ihe-akaebe nke mmebi ozu ahu mgbe ana anwa iwepu ya na igbe-ozu ahu ga enwe mmechu-ihu dika na obu nani isi ya na ubu ka ana ahuzi anya.

translation.en: The fabulous riches of the tomb are no longer in it, but have been removed to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ ihe oke ọnụ ahia nọ n'ili a anọghịzị na ya, kama e wegala ha na Ijipshịan Muziọm nọ na Kairo.

translation.en: Visitors with limited time would be best to spend their time elsewhere.
translation.ig: Ọ ga-akara ndị ọbịa nwere obere oge mma ka ha nọrọ ebe ọzọ.

translation.en: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman.
translation.ig: Fnọm Krọm, 12 km na ndịda ọdịda anyanwụ Siem Rip. Arụrụ ebe ofufe a dị n'elu ugwu na ngwụcha afọ nke narị itolu, mgbe Eze Yasovaman na-achị

translation.en: The gloomy atmosphere of the temple and the view over the Tonle Sap lake make the climb to the hill worthwhile.
translation.ig: Ọnọdụ ihu igwe gbachapụrụ agbachapụ nke ụlọ nsọ ahụ na nlele anya na ọdọ mmiri Tonle Sap na-eme ka ịrịgo ugwu ahụ dị ọnụ ahịa.

translation.en: A visit to the site can be conveniently combined with a boat trip to the lake.
translation.ig: Enwere ijeko jem ịga ebe ahụ na njem ụgbọ mmiri na-enweghị mmekpa ahụ.

translation.en: The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap.
translation.ig: Ngafe Angkọ bụ ebe a ga agaferịrị ịbanye ebe ofufe n'ihi nke a echefukwala iweta akwụkwọ akwụkwọ ngafe gị ma ị na-aga Tonle Sap.

translation.en: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital.
translation.ig: Jerusalem bụ isiobodo na obodo kachasị ukwu nke Israel, n'agbanyeghị na ọtụtụ n’ime mba ndị ọzọ na United Nations amataghị ya dị ka isiobodo nke Israel.

translation.en: The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years.
translation.ig: Obodo ochie ahụ nọ n’ụmụ Ugwu Judịa nwere akụkọ ihe gara aga ruru ọtụtụ puku afọ nke na-adọrọ mmasị.

translation.en: The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center.
translation.ig: Obodo ahu di nso n’anya ndi otu uzo okpukpe ato kwere na enwere otu chukwu - Judaism, otu Kristi na ndi alakwuba o bu obodo eji mere ebe isi ihe ime mmuo, okpukpe na omenala.

translation.en: Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel.
translation.ig: Nihi mputa-ihe okpukpere-chi nke mba ahu, ya na kpom-kwem otutu ogbe nke obodo ochie ogbe ahu, Jerusalem bu ot nime ebe bu isi nke njem-nlere-anya na Israel.

translation.en: Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.
translation.ig: Jerusalem nwere otutu ebe ihe mere mgbe ochie na ebe omenala, makwa nwee ebe ana azu ahia, ebe ana ere nri na cafe n’ekwo ekwo.

translation.en: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points.
translation.ig: Mba Ekụadọ na-achọ ka ndi obodo Kuba nata akwụkwọ nnabata tupu e si ọdụ ụgbọelu maọbu ụzọ mbata ndị ọzọ amaara amara bata Ekụadọ.

translation.en: This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements.
translation.ig: Ụlọọrụ Ekuwadọ na-ahụ maka mmekọ ha na mba ndị ọzọ ga-akwado leta a, ọ ga-ahụkwa na ọ gbasoro usoro niile o kwesiri ịgbaso.

translation.en: These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries.
translation.ig: Ihe ndị a achọrọ ka e mewere inye usoro nkwagharị ala ahaziri ahazi n'etiti mba abụọ ndị ahụ.

translation.en: Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement.
translation.ig: Ụmụ amaala Cuba bụ ndị nwere akwụkwọ ikike kaadị ndụ ndụ nke US kwesịrị ịga n'Ụlọ ọrụ Consul Ecuadorian iji nweta nkwenye mwepụ maka ihe a chọrọ.

translation.en: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.
translation.ig: Akwụkwọ ngafe gị ga adịrịrị ire opekarịa mpe afọ isii karịa oge njem gị. Akwụkwọ njem kennabata n'obodo ị na-aga dị mkpa igosipụta ogo ị ga-anọ.

translation.en: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate.
translation.ig: Njem nleta kara dị ọnụ ala maka òtù buru ibu, ya mere ọ bụrụ na ị nọ n’onwe gị ma ọ bụ gị na naanị otu enyi, gbalịa zute ndị ọzọ ma wube otu òtù nke mmadụ anọ ruo isii maka ọnụego ka mma kwa-otu-onye.

translation.en: However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị, nke a ekwesịghị inye gị nsogbu, n'ihi na ọtụtụ oge, a na-ewegharị ndị njem iji mejuo ụgbọ ala.

translation.en: It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.
translation.ig: Ọ dị n'ezie ka ọ bụ nnọọ otu ụzọ e ji aghọgbu ndị mmadụ ikweta na ha kwesiri ịkwụkwu ụgwọ.

translation.en: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins.
translation.ig: Dịrị ogologo gafee ebe ugwu nke Machu Picchu bụ ugwu mkpoda a, ọtụtụ mgbe na-abụkarị ndabere nye ọtụtụ fòto nke mkpọmkpọ ebe ndị ahụ.

translation.en: It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes.
translation.ig: Ọ dị tụ ka ihe nkụda mmụọ ma esi n'ala lee ya, ọ ga-arakwa ahụ nrigo, mana ọtụtụ ndi ahụ siri ike kwesịrị iji ihe dị ka nkeji iri anọ na ise rigoo ya.

translation.en: Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail.
translation.ig: A na-etinye ọtụtụ okwute n'okporo ụzọ, na mpaghara ala nke eriri igwe na - enye aka ijide onwe gi ofuma.

translation.en: That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly.
translation.ig: Ebe ekuola nke ahụ, na-atụ anya ịpụ n’ume, ma ledo onwe gị n’ime oke ndị kara kpodaa, tụmadị mgbe dị mmiri mmiri, dị ka o nwere ike ịbụ ihe egwu ngwa ngwa.

translation.en: There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.
translation.ig: Enwere obere ọgba dị nso n’elu a na-aga-agaferịrị, ọ dị ala ma na-agbatị karịa.

translation.en: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835.
translation.ig: Ihu ogige ahu na anu-ohia nke Galapagos kacha nma ino n’ugbo mmiri, dika nnoo Charles Darwin ji wee mee na-afo 1835.

translation.en: Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers.
translation.ig: Ụgbọ mmiri karịrị iri isii na-akwọfe mmiri Galapagos - nha ndị njem ha sitere na asatọ ruo narị.

translation.en: Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season).
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ na-akwụdobe ụgwọ ọnọdụ ha akwụdobe (dịka na ụgbọmmiri na-ejukarị eju n'oge nnukwu njem)

translation.en: Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships.
translation.ig: Kpachara anya hụ na ejenti ị ga-eji akwụ ụgwọ bụ onye maara Galapagos ọfụma ma mara ọtụtụ ụgbọ mmiri di iche iche.

translation.en: This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.
translation.ig: Nkea ga agbambo hu n’etikotara mmasi gi na/ma o bu ihe ji gi iga na ihu n’ugbo kwesiri ha.

translation.en: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile.
translation.ig: Tupu Ndị Spen abịarute na narị afọ iri na isii, ebe ugwu Chile nọ n’okpuru ọchịchị Inca ebe ndị amaala Araucanian (Mapuche) biri n’etiti na ebe ndịda Chile.

translation.en: The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence.
translation.ig: Ndị Mapuche bụkwa otu n'ime ndị amaala ikpeazụ Amerịka nwerela onwe ha, nke anabatabeghị kpam kpam n'okpuru ọchịchị ndị na-asụ asụsụ Spanish ruo mgbe nnwere onwe Chile gasịrị.

translation.en: Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.
translation.ig: N’agbanyeghị na Chile kwupụtara nnwereonwe ha na 1810 (n’etiti ụmụ agha Napoleon nke mere na  Spenụ enweghị gọọmentị etiti n'afọ olenaole gaa), e nwetaghị mmerị mkpebi megide ndị Spenụ ruo na 1818.

translation.en: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti
translation.ig: Republiki Dominica (Asụsụ Spaini: República Dominicana) bụ Mba Karibbiin nke nọrọ n’ọkara ebe ọwụwa anyanwụ nke agwaetiti nke Hispaniola, nke ya na Haiti kekọrịtara.

translation.en: Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo.
translation.ig: E wezụga aja ọnụmmiri ọcha na ala ugwu, mba ahụ bụ ebe obibi nye obodo Europe kacha ochie n'ime Americas, ugbu a bụ akụkụ nke Santo Domingo.

translation.en: The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE.
translation.ig: Ndị Taịnos na Karibes bu ụzọ biri na usuo ahụ. Ndị Karibes bụ ndị na-asụ asụsụ Arawakan bịara ebe afọ dịka nde iri tupu amụọ Kristi.

translation.en: Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors
translation.ig: N'ime afọ ole na ole na-eso mbịarute nke ndị na-eme nchọpụta na Europe, e belatara nke ukwuu onu ogugu ndi mmadu nke Tainos site n'aka Ndị mmeri ndị Spain

translation.en: Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.
translation.ig: Na ndabere na Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) n’etiti 1492 na 1498 ndị mmeri Ndị Spen gburu ihe dị ka Ndị Taínos 100,000.

translation.en: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building.
translation.ig: Jardín de la Unión. A rụrụ ohere a dịka atrium maka otu kọnventị narị afọ iri na asaa, nke bụ na Templo de San Diego bụ naanị ụlọ ka guzoro ruo ugbu a.

translation.en: It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night.
translation.ig: Ọ bụzi plaza izugbe, ebe ọtụtụ ihe na-eme n'ụtụtụ ma n'abalị.

translation.en: There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo.
translation.ig: Enwere ọtụtụ ụlọ nri gbara ogige ahụ gburugburu, a na enwe ihe omume nkere anya n'ehihie ma na mgbede.

translation.en: Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend.
translation.ig: Callejon del Basso(Alley of the kiss). Mbara ihu abuo sonso ihe kewara ha bu 69 centimeters bu ebe otu akuko ihunanya ndi mgbe ochie mere.

translation.en: For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.
translation.ig: Maka peeni ole na ola ụfọdụ ụmụaka ga-agwa gị akụkọ ahụ.

translation.en: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more.
translation.ig: Agwaetiti Bowen bụ njem ụbọchị maọbụ njem mmụta nke ngwụcha izuụka ama ama na-enye egwuregwu ụgbọamala, ije ogologo ije, ụlọahịa, ụlọ oriri na ọn̄ụn̄ụ, na ndi ozo.

translation.en: This authentic community is located in Howe Sound just off Vancouver, and is easily accessed via scheduled water taxis departing Granville Island in downtown Vancouver.
translation.ig: Ezigbo obodo a dị na Howe Sawụndụ ma a gasịa Vankuva, ma ọ dị mfe iji tagzi  na-agba na mmiri enweta ya site n'agwaetiti Granville n'ogbe Vankuva.

translation.en: For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a trek up the Sea to Sky corridor is essential.
translation.ig: Nye ndị ahụ ihe omume mpụta ezi na amasi, njem akụkụ oke osimiri ruo ebe ngafe elu.

translation.en: Whistler (1.5 hour drive from Vancouver) is expensive but well-known because of the 2010 Winter Olympics.
translation.ig: Ofu-opi (awa 1.5 ikwa-ugbo site na Vancouver) di oke-onu mana ama ya ama n’ihi asoroma-mpi olimpic nke Winta 2010.

translation.en: In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking.
translation.ig: N’oge oyi, nụrị ụtọ ụfọdụ egwuregwu skii kacha mma n’Ugwu Amerịka, ma n’ime oge ọkọchị nwaa ụfọdụ ezigbo ịgba ígwè n’ugwu.

translation.en: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena.
translation.ig: A ga-edote akwụkwọ nkwado n'ọdịnihu. Ị ga-enwerịrị akwụkwọ nkwado ma ọbụrụ na ị ga-anọfe abali na Sirena.

translation.en: Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service.
translation.ig: Sirena bụ sọ ụlọ nchekwa ọhịa na-enye ndị njem ebe ọnụnọ ma nri. La Leona, San Pedrilo, na Lọs Patos na-enye sọ ebe ọnụnọ n'enweghị nri.

translation.en: It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards
translation.ig: A ga-enwetali ikike idọsa moto n'aka Renja Steshọn na Puerto Jimenez, mana ị gaghị ejili kredit kad akwụ ha ụgwọ.

translation.en: The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival.
translation.ig: Ụlọọrụ na-elekọta ogige ahụ (MINAE) anaghị enye ikike mbata n'ogige ahụ karia otu ọnwa tupu ịbata.

translation.en: CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.
translation.ig: E nwere ike ịkwụ CafeNet El Sol ụgwọ n'ihu oge n'ọnụ US$30, maọbụ $10 maka tiketi otu ụbọchị; mụtakwuo maka nke a na peeji Kọkovado ha.

translation.en: The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean.
translation.ig: Isuo Kuk bụ obodo isuo nọ n'etiti ndịda oke osimiri Pasifik, nke dị na Polinesia ya na obodo Niu Zilandị gbara ogige nwere onwe.

translation.en: It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ agwaetiti nwere isuo iri na ise gbasara ihe karịrị kilomita nde abụo na puku abụọ n'elu mmiri.

translation.en: With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as "Hawaii down under".
translation.ig: Ha no n’otu oge ka Hawaii, ya mere na oge ufodu ana eche maka agwaetiti ndi a ka ha bu “Hawaii gbadara n’okpuru”.

translation.en: Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development.
translation.ig: N’agbanyeghị na ọ kara dị obere, ọ na-echeta ndị nleta Hawaii ndị kara nka tupu ọ ghụọ mba onwe ya na-enweghị ụmụ nnukwu họteelụ ndị nleta niile na mmepe ndị ọzọ.

translation.en: The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki.
translation.ig: Agwaetiti Osi nri ndị ahụ enweghị obodo ọ bụla mana ọ bụ agwaetiti dị iche iche iri na ise mejupụtara ya. Ndị isi ha bụ Rarotonga na Aitutaki.

translation.en: In developed countries today, providing deluxe bed and breakfasts has been raised to a sort of art-form.
translation.ig: Na mba ndi mepere-emep taa, iweputa akwa-ndina nke ndi-ukwu na nri-ututu ka eweliri ruo ihe di na udi-nka.

translation.en: At the top end, B&Bs obviously compete mainly on two main things: bedding and breakfast.
translation.ig: Na mpara elu-elu, na ihe ahu anya B&Bs na amarita-aka karia nime ihe abuo putara-ihe: ndina na akwa na nri ututu.

translation.en: Accordingly, at the finest such establishments one is apt to find the most luxurious bedding, maybe a handmade quilt or an antique bed.
translation.ig: N'ihi ya, n'ụlọ ọrụ ndị kachasị mma mmadụ ga-achọrịrị ihe eji achọ ihe ndina kachasi nma, ọ nwere ike bụrụ nke ejiri aka mee ma ọ bụ ihe ndina ochie.

translation.en: Breakfast may include seasonal delights of the region or the host's speciality dish.
translation.ig: Nri ụtụtụ nwere ike ịgụnye nri ụtọ n'oge nke mpaghara ahụ ma ọ bụ nri pụrụ iche nke onye nnabata.

translation.en: The setting might be an historic old building with antique furnishings, manicured grounds and a swimming pool.
translation.ig: Mwube ahụ nwere ike ịbụ otu ụlọ kara nka keakụkọala nwere ụmụ ntinye ihe ime ụlọ nke mgbe ochie, ala awụrụmaziri nke ọma na otu ebe igwu mmiri.

translation.en: Getting into your own car and heading off on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity.
translation.ig: Ibanye na moto gi gawa ogologo njem na enye obi uto n’agbanyeghina o di mfe.

translation.en: Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably already familiar with driving your car and know its limitations.
translation.ig: N'adịghị ka nnukwu ụgbọ ndị ọzọ, ịnya ụgbọ ala gị nwere ike ọ maala gị ahụ Ị makwaara ebe ike ya ruru

translation.en: Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily attract unwanted attention.
translation.ig: Iwube ụlọikwuu n’ala mmadụ ma ọ bụ n’ime otu obodo nwere nha ọ bụla nwere ike ịdọta na mfe anya a na-achọghị.

translation.en: In short, using your car is a great way to take a road trip but seldom in itself a way to "camp".
translation.ig: Na mkpirisi, njem na aka mma n'ụgbọala nke onwe n'ihi na ya onwe ya bụ ụdị "njem nnọgharị".

translation.en: Car camping is possible if you have a large minivan, SUV, Sedan or Station Wagon with seats that lay down.
translation.ig: Njem nnọgharị ụgbọala kwere omume ma I nwee nnukwu ụgbọala, ọkwụ ọtọ ekele eze maọbụ ụgbọala oche ya nwere ike idina ala.

translation.en: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ ụlọ nkwari akụ nwere ihe nketa si n'oge ụgbọ oloko na oke ụgbọ mmiri wuru, tupu agha zuru ụwa ọnụ nke abụọ, na afọ nke narị iri na itolu maọbụ isi mbido nke narị iri abụo.

translation.en: These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife.
translation.ig: Ụlọ nkwari akụ ndị a bụ ebe ndi bụ mmadụ n'oge ahụ ga-anọ, ma nwee oriri na nkwari na ndụ abalị.

translation.en: The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character.
translation.ig: Ntinyegasi ndi agba-ochie, enweghi ihe ndi eji ebi ugbua, na otu ime-okenye na amara bu kwa otu nime akparama-agwa ha.

translation.en: While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries.
translation.ig: N'agbanyeghị na ọ na-abụkarị ihe onwunwe nke otu onye, ụfọdụ oge ha na-anabata ndị isi obodo na ndị a maara aha ha bụ ndị ọbịa.

translation.en: A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.
translation.ig: Onye njem nwere nnukwu ego nwere-ike chee banyere ifeghari uwa nile, kujisichaa ahu na onino nime otutu ulo-oriri ndia.

translation.en: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit.
translation.ig: Njikọ mgbanwe nke ile ọbịa bụ nzụkọ na ejikọ ndị njem na ndị obodo n’ime ụmụ obodo ndị ha na-aga eleta.

translation.en: Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification.
translation.ig: Isonye n’ụdị netwọọk na-achọkarị fọm nke ndịnọrụ; na-agbanyeghị n’ụfọdụ netwọọk na-enye maọbụ chọọ nkwenyeeziokwu ọzọ.

translation.en: A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers.
translation.ig: A ga-enyekwa, n'akwụkwọ na/maọbụ n'ịntanetị, aha ụfọdụ ndị dị njikere ịnabata; ụfọdụ oge a ga-etinye ama ndị njem ha nabatagoro mgbe gara aga.

translation.en: Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay.
translation.ig: E bidoro Kaụchsọfịn n'ọnwa Jenụwarị nke afọ 2004 mgbe onye n'ede usoro ọrụ kọmputa bụ Kasi Fentụn chọtara njem ụgbọelu dị ọnụ ala ịga obodo Aịsland mana onweghi ebe ọ ga-anọ.

translation.en: He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.
translation.ig: Ọ zitere ụmụakwụkwọ ozi-e na mahadum ma ọ natara ọnụọgụ nke enweghị atụ nke onyinye maka ụlọ obibi n'efu.

translation.en: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too.
translation.ig: Ulo-obia na elekota karisia ndị na-eto eto – ndi obia na abiakari no n’afo agbata iri-abuo – mana inwere ike ihuta ndi njem ozo ebe ahu kwa mgbe.

translation.en: Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.
translation.ig: Anaghị ahụtakarị ezinụlọ chị ụmụ, mana ụfọdụ ebe ọnụnọ na-enye ha ụlọ nkeonwe.

translation.en: The city of Beijing in China will be the host city of the Olympic Winter Games in 2022, which will make it the first city to have hosted both the summer and winter Olympics.
translation.ig: Obodo Beijing di na China ga bu obodo ga afu maka Egwuregwu Oge Oyi Olympic na 2022, nke a ga-eme ya o buru obodo izizi fugoro maka Olympics nke oge okochi na nke oge oyi.

translation.en: Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies and the indoor ice events.
translation.ig: Beijing ga-eme mmemme mmeghe na mmechi ya na ihe omume ais nke ime ụlọ.

translation.en: Other skiing events will be at the Taizicheng ski area in Zhangjiakou, about 220 km (140 miles) from Beijing.
translation.ig: Ihe omume igba-igwe mmiri ndi ozo ga adi na ogbe igwe mmiri Taizicheng di na Zhangjiakou, ihe dika 220 km (mailu 140) site naBeijing.

translation.en: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ n’ime ụlọ nsọ nwere otu ememme Kwa afọ na-ebido site na ngwụcha Nọvemba ruo N’Etiti nke Mee, nke dị iche na-ndabere nke Kalenda kwa afọ nke ụlọ nsọ ọ bụla.

translation.en: Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ n'ime mmemme ebe ofufe ahụ ka a na-emenyere mmemme ncheta ụlọ ofufe maọbụ mmemme ncheta ọmụmụ chi ha maọbụ ihe omume ọbụla dị ịrịba ama n'ụlọ ofufe ahụ.

translation.en: Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.
translation.ig: Mmeme ulo-okpukpere Kerala di ezigbo uto nlele, na nzom-ije mbata nke enyi ejikwara ngwa, ngwa-uri ulo-okpukpere na emume ndi ozo.

translation.en: A World's Fair (commonly called World Exposition, or simply Expo) is large international festival of arts and sciences.
translation.ig: Mgbasa ozi-ahia nke mba uwa (onye-obula na akpo Ngosiputa mba Uwa, maobu ebe odimfe Ngosi) bu nnukwu mmemme nka na uzu nke obodo na obodo nile nke mba uwa

translation.en: Participating countries present artistic and educational displays in national pavilions to showcase world issues or their country's culture and history.
translation.ig: Obodo ndị na-esonye na egosi ngosi nka na nkụzi iji gosipụta ihe na-eme n'ụwa maọbụ omenala obodo na akụkọ ihe mere eme.

translation.en: International Horticultural Expositions are specialised events which showcase floral displays, botanical gardens and anything else to do with plants.
translation.ig: Ngosipụta okooko osisi nke mba ụwa bụ mmemme ndị pụrụ iche ebe a na-egosipụ ifuru, ubi mkpụrụ osisi na ihe ọzọ ọbụla gbasara osisi.

translation.en: Although in theory they can take place annually (so long as they are in different countries), in practice they are not.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị n’ime tiori ha nwere ike imeli kwa afọ (ọ bụrụhaala na ha nọ na mba dị iche iche), na omume ha anọghị ya.

translation.en: These events normally last anywhere between three and six months, and are held on sites no smaller than 50 hectares.
translation.ig: Emume ndị a na-anọtekarị aka oge ọ bụla nọ n’etiti ọnwa atọ ruo isii, ma a na-eme ha n’ebe na-adịghị obere karịa hekta 50.

translation.en: There are many different film formats that have been used over the years. Standard 35 mm film (36 by 24 mm negative) is much the commonest.
translation.ig: E nwere usoro ihe nlele dị iche iche eji mere ihe n'oge gara aga. Ihe nlele tozuru oke nke mm35 (negetivu 36 ga na 24) bụ nke dị ebe niile.

translation.en: It can usually be replenished fairly easily if you run out, and gives resolution roughly comparable to a current DSLR.
translation.ig: Enwere ike imejugharị ya na-enweghi mmekasị ahụ ma ọgwụ ma o nwekwara ngosipụta ihe dị ka nke DSLR.

translation.en: Some medium-format film cameras use a 6 by 6 cm format, more precisely a 56 by 56 mm negative.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ igwe foto ọkara nwere akụkụ sentimita 6 n'elu 6, ya bụ negetiv nwere milimita 56 n'elu 56, ikwu ya kpọmkwem.

translation.en: This gives resolution almost four times that of a 35 mm negative (3136 mm2 versus 864).
translation.ig: Nke a na-enye ụcha ngosịpụta ihe ruru ugboro anọ nke ihe otu 35mm odi iche (3136 mm2 vesọs 864).

translation.en: Wildlife is among the most challenging motifs for a photographer, and needs a combination of good luck, patience, experience and good equipment.
translation.ig: Anụ ọhịa so na mọtif ndị kachasị ata akpụ nye onye na-ese fòto, ma chọrọ mgwakọta nke ihu ọma, ndidi, ahụmihe na ngwaọrụ dị mma.

translation.en: Wildlife photography is often taken for granted, but like photography in general, a picture is worth a thousand words.
translation.ig: Osise foto anụ ọhịa na-abụkarị ihe ejighị kpọrọ ihe, mana dị ka osise foto n'ozuzu ya, otu foto bara uru ruru otu puku okwu.

translation.en: Wildlife photography often requires a long telephoto lens, though things like a flock of birds or a tiny creature need other lenses.
translation.ig: Foto anụ ọhịa na-achọ ogologo oghere telephoto, n’agbanyeghi ihe dika igwe nnụnụ maọbụ obere okike choro oghere ndi ozo.

translation.en: Many exotic animals are hard to find, and parks sometimes have rules about taking photographs for commercial purposes.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ mgbe, ọ na-ara ahụ ịchọta ụmụ anụmanụ ọpụrụiche, na ụfọdụ ogige anụmanụ nwere iwu maka ise ha foto a ga-etinye n'ihe ọbụla a ga-ere ere.

translation.en: Wild animals might either be shy or aggressive. The environment might be cold, hot, or otherwise hostile.
translation.ig: Anụ ọhịa nwere ike na-eme ihere maọbụ na-alụso ọgụ. Gburugburu ya nwere ike dị oyi, ọkụ, maọbụ dị njọ.

translation.en: The world has over 5,000 different languages, including more than twenty with 50 million or more speakers.
translation.ig: Asụsụ karịrị puku ise dị n'ụwa, ma nwekwaa ihe karịrị iri abụọ nke ndị na-asụ ya nwere ike ịkarị nde iri ise.

translation.en: Written words are often easier to understand than spoken words, also. This is especially true of addresses, which are often difficult to pronounce intelligibly.
translation.ig: Edemede na-adịkwakarị mfe nghọta karịa okwu ekwuru ekwu. Nke a bụ eziokwu n'ebe agwamokwu nọ; ha na-esikarị ike ịkpọpụta ọfụma.

translation.en: Many entire nations are completely fluent in English, and in even more you can expect a limited knowledge - especially among younger people.
translation.ig: N'ọtụtụ mba dị iche iche, mmadụ niile maara asụ oyibo ọfụma, ma na mba ndị ọzọ, a ga-enwe ndị matụ obere oyibo - ọkachasị ndị na-eto eto.

translation.en: Imagine, if you will, a Mancunian, Bostonian, Jamaican and Sydneysider sitting around a table having dinner at a restaurant in Toronto.
translation.ig: Cheegodu ya, maoburu na inwere ike, onye Mancunian, onye Bostonian, onye Jamaica na onye Sydneyside nnoro okpokoro okirikiri na eri nri anyasi na Toronto.

translation.en: They're regaling each other with stories from their hometowns, told in their distinct accents and local argot.
translation.ig: Ha na-eleta onwe ha anya site n'ịkọ akụkọ si n’obodo ha ga, ha ji ndebeolu ha pụrụ iche na olu otu ha wee na-akọ ya.

translation.en: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food.
translation.ig: Igo nri na nnukwu ụlọ ahịa supamaket na abụkarị usoro ka ọnụ ala ịzụ onwe nri. Ebe ohere isi nri adịghị, enweghị nhọrọ ọzọ karịa nri esigoro esi.

translation.en: Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food.
translation.ig: Nnukwu ụlọahịa gasị na-ewetazi mpaghara dị iche iche ndị nwere nri e siri esi. Ụfọdụ na-ewepụtakwa ihe eji esitụ nri n'ọkụ.

translation.en: In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.
translation.ig: Na mba ufodu ma o bu na’ufodu ulo ahia enwere na opekata mpe otu ebe a na-ere nri, oge ufodu o na abukari ebe nkiti anaghi agara onu.

translation.en: Make and carry copies of your policy and your insurer's contact details with you.
translation.ig: Mepụta ma na-ebugharị akwụkwọ amụma gị ya na akara njimama onye mkpuchi gị.

translation.en: They need to show the insurer's e-mail address and international phone numbers for advice/authorizations and making claims.
translation.ig: Ha kwesịrị igosi adreesị ozi ịntanetị onye mkpuchi na akara ekwentị n'egosi obodo osi maka ndụmọdụ na nzọrọ.

translation.en: Have another copy in your luggage and online (e-mail to yourself with attachment, or stored in the "cloud").
translation.ig: Ị ga-enwe akwụkwọ ọzọ nke ga-adị n'akpa gị na nke ị ga-etinye n'ịntanetị (zigara ya onwe gị dịka mgbakwunye, maọbụ ịchekwaa ya na "ọwa nchekwa ikuku").

translation.en: If traveling with a laptop or tablet, store a copy in its memory or disc (accessible without the internet).
translation.ig: Oburu na imewe njem jide igwe laptopu maobu ekwe-nti tableti, chekwaa oyiri n’ime ucje ya maobu diski (enwere-ike inweta ma ejighi intaneti).

translation.en: Also give policy/contact copies to traveling companions and relatives or friends back home willing to help.
translation.ig: Nyekwuo nn̄omi gasị nke iwu/mkpọtụrụ nye ndị enyi ndị njem na ikwu ma ọ bụ ndị enyi nọ n’ụlọ na-achọ inye aka.

translation.en: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat.
translation.ig: Moose (amakwara dị ka elk) enweghị mburu pụta ụwa ịgha eze mana ha ga-aga chedo onwe ha ma ha hụta otu ihe ize ndụ.

translation.en: When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.
translation.ig: Mgbe ndị mmadụ ahụghị anụ ọhịa muz ka ihe nwere ike ikpata ihe ize ndụ, ha nwere ike ịbịaru ya nso karịa ka ha kwesịrị were tinye onwe ha n'ọnọdụ ize ndụ.

translation.en: Drink alcoholic drinks with moderation. Alcohol affects everyone differently, and knowing your limit is very important.
translation.ig: Añụfela mmanya ike oke. Mmanya ike na emetụta ndị mmadụ n'ụdị dị iche iche, ịmara oke gị dị oke mkpa.

translation.en: Possible long term health events from excessive drinking can include liver damage and even blindness and death. The potential danger is increased when consuming illegally produced alcohol.
translation.ig: Ụmụ ihe omume ogologo oge ahụike kwere omume sitere n'ịn̄ụ oke mmanya nwere ike ịgụnye ọrịa dị ka mmebi umeji, nakwa ọ bụna ikpu isi na ọnwụ. Ihe ize ndụ nwere ike ime na-amụbanye ma a na an̄ụ mmanya ike a rụpụtara n'ụzọ megidere iwu.

translation.en: Illegal spirits can contain various dangerous impurities including methanol, which can cause blindness or death even in small doses.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ mmanya ike ndị megidere iwu nwere ike nwee ọtụtụ ihe adịghị mma n'ime ha na-agụnye metanọl, nke nwere ike ịkpata ikpu ìsì ma ọ bụ ọnwụ n'ime nha ndị dị obere.

translation.en: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower.
translation.ig: Ugogbe anya nwere ike ịdị ọnụala karịa na mba ofesi, ọkachasị n'obodo na-erite obere ego, ebe ụgwọ ọrụ pere mpe karịa.

translation.en: Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere.
translation.ig: Tulegodu inweta nyocha anya n’ụlọ, tụmadị ma ọ bụrụ na mkpuchite ahụike ekpuchighị ya, na iwetakwa ndenye ọgwụ a ga-enye ya ebe ọzọ.

translation.en: High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.
translation.ig: Okpokolo aha-brandi ogo-elu dị dị n’ụdị ebe ahụ nwere ike inwe nsogbu abụọ; ụfọdụ nwere ike ịbụ adịgboroja, ma ezigbo ya ebubatara nwere ike inwe ịdị dị oke ọnụ karịa n’ụlọ.

translation.en: Coffee is one of the world's most traded commodities, and you can probably find many types in your home region.
translation.ig: Kọfi sọ na ihe kachasị aga ahịa n'ụwa, I nwekwara ike ịchọta ọtụtụ ụdịdị ya n'ebe isi.

translation.en: Nevertheless, there are many distinctive ways of drinking coffee around the world that are worth experiencing.
translation.ig: N’agbanyeghị, e nwere ọtụtụ ụzọ pụrụiche ịn̄ụ kọfị gburugburu ụwa nke kwesịrị ka e nwee ahụmihe ha.

translation.en: Canyoning (or: canyoneering) is about going in a bottom of a canyon, which is either dry or full of water.
translation.ig: Ime egwuregwu n'ime ndagwurugwu (maọbụ: ime njegharị n'ime ndagwurugwu) bụ ihe gbasara ịga n’ala ala ndagwurugwu, nke nwere ike ịdị ọkọrọ maọbụ juputa na mmiri.

translation.en: Canyoning combines elements from swimming, climbing and jumping--but requires relatively little training or physical shape to get started (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).
translation.ig: Egwuregwu kanyọnịn na-ejikọta njìmebe ndị si na igwu mmiri, ịrị elu na ịwụ elu--mana chọtụ obere ọzụzụ ma ọ bụ ọdịdị mma nke anụ ahụ imalite (n'ịtụnyere ịrị elu okwute, iji skuba amanye na mmiri maọbụ ime skii ugwu, maka ọmụmaatụ).

translation.en: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails.
translation.ig: Mkpagharị bụ ihe omume anm na eme n'iro nke ihe sonyeere ya bụ ịga ije eke dị gburugburu, karicha n'ụzọ eji aga ije.

translation.en: Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day.
translation.ig: Ịgagharị n’ọhịa n’ụbọchị metụtara ntoanya dị obere karịa otu maịlị ruo ntoanya ndị enwere ike ịgarụ n’otu ụbọchị.

translation.en: For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them.
translation.ig: Maka ịrị ugwu n'ụbọchị site n'okporo dị mfe obere nkwadobe ka ọ ga-ewe, ma onye ọbụla ahụ gbasituru ike ga-ekpori ndụ na ha.

translation.en: Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.
translation.ig: Ezinụlọ ndị nwere obere ụmụaka nwere ike ịchọkwu njikere, mana otu ụbọchị n’ezi dị mfe omume ma ọ bụrụgodu n’agụnye ụmụ ọhụrụ na ụmụaka ọtakara.

translation.en: Internationally, there are nearly 200 running tour organizations. Most of them operate independently.
translation.ig: Gburugburu ụwa, e nweruru ụlọọrụ njegharị ịgba ọsọ narị abụọ. Ọtụtụ n'ime ha na-arụ ọrụ nke onwe.

translation.en: The Global Running Tours successor, Go Running Tours networks dozens of sightrunning providers on four continents.
translation.ig: Ndị nnọchiteanya Global Rọnịn Tọọz, Go Rọnịn Tọọz na ejikọta ọtụtụ ndị nweta mmemme ọsọ na kọntinent anọ.

translation.en: With roots in Barcelona's Running Tours Barcelona and Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, it was quickly joined by Running Tours Prague based in Prague and others.
translation.ig: O bidoro site na Running Tours Barcelona na Running Copenhagen nke Copenhagen, mana o gbughi oge Running Tours Prague nke nọ na Prague na ndị ọzọ esonye ya.

translation.en: There are many things you have to take into consideration before and when you travel somewhere.
translation.ig: Onwere ọtụtụ ihe ị kwesịrị itule tupu ị gaa njem ebe ọzọ.

translation.en: When you travel, expect things not to be like they are "back home". Manners, laws, food, traffic, lodging, standards, language and so on will to some extent differ from where you live.
translation.ig: Ị gaa njem, dị njikere na ihe agaghị adị ka ọ dị "n'ụlọ" Agwa, iwu, nri, ụzọ, ebe ezumike, ụkpụrụ, asụsụ ma dịrị gawa ga enwe ka ọ ga-esị adị iche na otu osiri dị n'ebe ibi.

translation.en: This is something you always need to keep in mind, to avoid disappointment or perhaps even distaste over local ways to do things.
translation.ig: Nke a bụ ihe ikwesịrị ibu n'uche ka Ị ghara inwe ngharịpụ maọbụ obi mgbarụ n'ebe usoro esi eme ihe dị.

translation.en: Travel agencies have been around since the 19th century. A travel agent is usually a good option for a journey which extends beyond a traveller's previous experience of nature, culture, language or low-income countries.
translation.ig: Ụmụ ụlọ ọrụ njem anọọla ya kemgbe narị afọ nke iri na itoolu. Otu onye ụlọ ọrụ njem na-abụkarị nhọrọ dị mma maka njem nke gafere karịa ahụmihe gara aga nke onye njem nke ụwa, omenala, asụsụ ma ọ bụ mba ndị nwere obere ego mkpata.

translation.en: Although most agencies are willing to take on most regular bookings, many agents specialise in particular types of travel, budget ranges or destinations.
translation.ig: Obu ezie na ihe-ka-na-onuogugu ulo nnochita-anya di njikere iwerekwu ohere-ka-na-onuogugu otutu ndi nnochita-anya na elekwasi anya na otu udi ime-njem,ogo nhzi na ebe-ana-aga.

translation.en: It can be better to use an agent who frequently books similar trips to yours.
translation.ig: Onwere ike ka nma iji onye nnochita-anya onye gana edebere gi ohere ime njem kwa mgbe yiri nke gi.

translation.en: Take a look at what trips the agent is promoting, whether on a website or in a shop window.
translation.ig: Lee anya na ihe njem oje ozi na ebuli elu, ma o bu na webusaiti ma o bu na windo ulo ahia.

translation.en: If you want to see the world on the cheap, for necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are some ways to do that.
translation.ig: Ọ bụrụ na ị chọrọ ịgagharị akụkụ ụwa di iche iche n'emefughi oke ego, ikekwe maka ịghaghị ime ya, maọbụ maka ụdịrị ndụ i na-ebi, maọbụ naanị dịka ịma aka, enwere etu a ga-esi eme ya.

translation.en: Basically, they fall into two categories: Either work while you travel or try and limit your expenses. This article is focused on the latter.
translation.ig: N'ụzọ bụ isi, ha dabara n’ụdị abụọ: Ma ọ bụ rụọ ọrụ dị ka ị na-eme njem ma ọ bụ gbalie ma belata mmefu ego gị. Edemede a gbadoro anya na nke ikpeazụ.

translation.en: For those willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability to push expenses down close to zero, see minimum budget travel.
translation.ig: Maka ndị dị njikere ịhapụ nkasi obi, oge na mmadụ ịkọ ihe ha ga-eme ka ha wee nwee ike ịkwụ naanị obere ụgwọ, lee ụgwọ njem kachasị nta.

translation.en: The advice assumes that travellers do not steal, trespass, participate in the illegal market, beg, or otherwise exploit other people for their own gain.
translation.ig: Ndụmọdụ a zubere na ndị njem anaghị ezu ohi, jehiee ụzọ, tinye aka na ire ahịa megidere iwu, rịọọ arịrịọ, maọbụ rigbuo ndị ọzọ maka ọdịmma nke ha.

translation.en: An immigration checkpoint is usually the first stop when disembarking from a plane, a ship, or another vehicle.
translation.ig: Ebe nnyocha njem mbata na ọpụpụ na-abụkarị ebe nkwụsị mbụ mgbe a na-apụta n'ụgbọelu, ụgbọmmiri, maọbụ n'ụgbọ ọzọ.

translation.en: In some cross-border trains inspections are done on the running train and you should have valid ID with you when boarding one of those trains.
translation.ig: N’ufodu ugbo oloko n’agafe mba di iche iche ana enyocha ha mgbe ha na gbaa, ya bu na ikwesiri ijide njirimara bara uru mgbe iga abanye otu n’imeugbo oloko ahu.

translation.en: On night sleeper trains, passports may be collected by the conductor so that you do not have your sleep interrupted.
translation.ig: N'ụgbọoloko abalị a na-arahụ ụra na ya, onye nhazi ụgbọ nwere ike ịnara gị akwụkwọ ikike ime njem gị ka a ghara inye gị nsogbu ka ị na-arahụ ụra.

translation.en: Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process. In some countries, you must register your presence and address where you are staying with the local authorities.
translation.ig: Ndebanye aha so n'ihe a na-achọ n'usoro ịnweta visa. Na mba ụfọdụ, ị ghaghị ịdebanye ọnụnọ gị na adresi ebe i bi na nke ndị isi ala.

translation.en: This might require filling out a form with the local police or a visit to the immigration offices.
translation.ig: Nke a nwere ike ịchọ idejupụta otu fọọm gị na ndị uwe ojii keobodo ma ọ bụ otu nleta na ụlọ ọrụ mbata na ọpụpụ.

translation.en: In many countries with such a law, local hotels will handle the registration (make sure to ask).
translation.ig: N'ọtụtụ obodo nwere iwu dị otu ahụ, ụlọ nkwari akụ dị gburugburu ga-ahụ maka ndebanye aha (hụ na ịjụrụ ese)

translation.en: In other cases, only those staying outside of tourist accommodations need to register.  However, this makes the law much more obscure, so find out beforehand.
translation.ig: N'ọnọdụ ndị ọzọ, naanị ndị na-anọ na mpụga nke ụlọ ndị njem nleta bụ aghaghị ịdebanye aha. Agbanyeghị, nke a mere ka iwu dịkwuo mgbagwojuanya, ya mere chọpụta tupu oge eruo.

translation.en: Architecture is concerned with the design and construction of buildings. The architecture of a place is often a tourist attraction in its own right.
translation.ig: Architecture n’afu maka iru ulo n’udi ulo. Architecture ebe obula bu ihe nkiri n’onwe ya.
